Reviews.Title: “Birthday treat”
Reviews.Author: whiterosetraveller
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a four night stay at the Hotel Scribe as a special birthday present for my wife. Right from the start we were really well looked after with the receptionist giving us a tour of the facilities and showing us up personally to our room. The room itself was very well appointed and as others have said the bed is extremely comfortable. The present for my wife and the personal message left in our room were really appreciated. It is true, all the staff are very friendly and make you feel a valued guest, even though it was our first visit. The hotel is central and within walking distance to all the major sites but also cloe to the Opera metro stop. Would we stay again? Of course, I would thoroughly recommend this hotel. Thank you Hotel Scribe.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and friendly”
Reviews.Author: saxan
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here last April through a Costco Executive Members offer. We stayed 11 nights. It was our first time to the Paris, and this hotel seemed like a good choice for the Opera District. I was interested in the hotel, particularly with its long history, once known as Le Salon Indien du Grand Café. I studied cinema in college and found this fact interesting, since this is where Lumière brothers first screened exhibited in 1895 a new medium - known as film, for the public. I presume not far from where they now serve breakfast there. So cool. The staff was very friendly. I do not speak french, and I tried to politely get by. The staff would talk to me in English, as it was obvious I was not speaking their language so well. I really enjoyed everyone I came into contact with there, they all were very patient and polite. The lady handling my dry cleaning, the front desk staff, the concierge, and even the staff you met at breakfast - all very pleasant. The breakfast was incredible. A diverse selection of french baked goods, to miso soup... to fresh juices and cheeses. The tea room was fun - they have a wonderful selection of teas and macaroons. The hotel is not far from other locations - you can walk a different direction each day and see so many things. We visited the Hemingway Bar at the Ritz Carlton, the Cartier store - amazing what is on display there as you can guess, many great coffee shops and retailers. There is a nice wine shop across the street with a huge selection. I believe three levels. We took home a bordeaux which was excellent. There is also a nice perfume shop downstairs, a few doors away, called Divine i think. I found cuban cigar vendor not to far away either, which my wife wasn't too happy about. The rooms are not huge, but they are absolutley fine. You are in Paris, not Texas... you should to set your expectations accordingly. They also have security cameras in the halls, I thought that was a nice they are looking out for their guests.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Nazim S
Reviews.Content: This is a perfect 5 stars hotel in the centre of Paris, near Galeries Lafayete, all necessary transport hubs and the Opera. The service and rooms are wonderful. This is a very good choice that I made for Paris. But still guests must know that: 1) sometimes when the hotel is full you have to wait 10-15 minutes to have your breakfast in the morning 2) during my stay the steets around were full with homeless people 3) it was really impossible to have a cup of tea in the Tea house closed to the hotel on the first day of our visit at 12.00 These are things to avoid. But in general the hotel is perfect and I reccomend it to all, especially travelling with families.

Reviews.Title: “People make or break the experience”
Reviews.Author: SnailP
Reviews.Content: After staying at Hotel Scribe last year, I had a fabulous stay. I called to confirm my room request and was assured that it was reserved. Upon arrival, this request was not fullfilled and my room was not ready. We arrived at the hotel at 2pm (we are A Club Gold Sofitel members which includes early check-in.) We were finally able to check-in at around 5pm. We paid for a club sofitel room which allows you soft drinks, newspaper and baked goodies daily. When we did not receive the latter of the three and when we informed the front desk of this we were were told you only get a welcome gift and champagne. I had to proceed to explain that this was not the case and our amenities included this. I expected the same helpfullness I received at my last stay at Hotel Scribe. I wonder how many people pay for this service and never get it. If it were my first stay at Scribe I wouldn't have known. Once, again our wonderful concierge Mairie shines through. I also spoke to her before my arrival (she remembered me from a year before, wow.) and asked her to make several lunch and dinner reservations and was perfectly accommodated. She will be the reason we come back. Audrey, the guest relations manager, is also a star. She handeled a very difficult situation dealing with theft on the Paris tranportation system. She handeled it with utmost grace and professionalism. The pastries are not made on the premises and be careful which one you choose, because their looks may deceive you. Nothing is perfect but I wish my experience was the same as last year. Last year I was wowed, this year, it was just another hotel experience with the usual mistakes. The beds are still fantastic though and the hotel is extremely clean and maintained.

Reviews.Title: “What an exceptional place to stay”
Reviews.Author: KiwiLlama
Reviews.Content: I don't often write a review and have really been prompted to do so by people threatening to write bad reviews if they do not get a discount on checkout. This Hotel was the perfect place for a 4 day getaway while working in the south of France. We had the most amazing time and all the staff at the hotel were great. The only disappointing thing about the hotel was the fact that we could snot take the bed with us there and then.....We did have to order it and have it delivered. Fantastic place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “A week-end to remember”
Reviews.Author: Delevanti
Reviews.Content: I will not got too much into details about the hotel Scribe's specifics, because all the prior reviews took care of that and most of them seem accurate. But what I can tell you is that 5 star hotels are what they are for a reason. They give you what you expect: a 5 star service in a 5 star environment. But what separates l'hotel Scribe from the rest is that they make you feel like you are their only and favorite customer at all times. We were there for a romantic week-end getaway in Paris and they went out of their way (or maybe that's what they always do) to make sure all our needs were not only met but exceeded. Getting a room upgrade is not rare in the hotel industry. But I don't know many hotels that upgrade you and doesn't tell you about it, that's just a whole other level. If you're looking for a great Parisian hotel in a great Parisian "quartier", don't look any further, I know we won't! Thank you l'Hotel Scribe

Reviews.Title: “Quintessential Paris”
Reviews.Author: JElizabethB
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Scribe has a warm inviting ambience and [unlike some of the larger 5 star establishments] feels quintessentially French. As an Australian in Paris... I wanted that. The room was compact but beautifully appointed with a balcony overlooking the central courtyard below. The bathroom was surprisingly large by Parisian standards and well stocked with gorgeous toiletriles and fluffy white towels. Bed was pure heaven to sink into at the end of the day with crisp white linen and luxurious down pillows. The location is perfect for the Opera Printemps and Galleries la Fayette and the Louvre. I loved the small gestures such as complimentary bottled water and extra towels. A beautiful hotel I would not hesitate to stay in again. I can't wait to go back...

Reviews.Title: “The best beds in the world”
Reviews.Author: DrLivingstone100
Reviews.Content: This is a grand Parisian hotel literally next door to L'Opera. It was recently the subject of major refurb. The public areas are stylish and classically French. The basic rooms as with most French hotels are on the small side but they are extremely well equipped. The beds are amazingly comfortable and it's a struggle to get up in the morning. It's not cheap and nor is breakfast but you generally get what you're paying for.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Paris hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cas-Perth
Reviews.Content: We had originally booked an apartment for our stay in Paris. On arrival we were so disappointed that we decided to go all the way and book ourselves and two teenage boys into a 5 star hotel. Being New Year's Eve this was no mean feat but were lucky enough to get the last two rooms at the Scribe. How lucky were we. The staff were wonderful from the moment we arrived. Nothing was too much trouble. The concierges (two different ladies) went out of their way to help, even securing us excellent last minute seats at the Moulin Rouge. The location is fantastic, close to shops, cafes, restaurants and many sites. We will definitely recommend this hotel and look forward to returning in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Ping000
Reviews.Content: Beautiful rooms....great bed, so had a superb night. Location is very central, so great for a visit. Breakfast was worth a 8, so good...not super. But what I liked was that is was very precisely checked and controlled by somebody with a temperature meter.... I also liked the typical 'scent' of the scribe.... And....also very very important, there's free wifi in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and convenient”
Reviews.Author: Gretel101
Reviews.Content: All our expectations were met when we stayed at Hotel Scribe this summer. Being in the Opera area, it is very very convenient to transportation to/from the airport, tour buses, great restaurants, cafes and the major sites. Our room was not large, but very comfortable, relaxing and decorated very tastefully. The bathroom was clean and elegant. We found the staff helpful as well. We have recommended this hotel to people just getting to learn Paris for the above reasons. And we will probably stay there again:)

Reviews.Title: “Amazing by all means. Service and experience makes one forget the rate!”
Reviews.Author: AlfieD15
Reviews.Content: Love everything about this hotel. Smells great, staff are very friendly, food is amazing when I order room service, bed is comfortable, room is always very clean and love the Hermes eau d'orange touch that they add to the experience. This hotel makes me look forward to going to Paris even more

Reviews.Title: “Sets high standards for Paris”
Reviews.Author: travellinman003
Reviews.Content: Paris has a questionable reputation to which this hotel gives the lie. Service here is friendly, charming and efficient from the moment you arrive at the door. Add to this comfortable accommodation and a great location - I won't be looking for a different hotel next time or any time I come to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Place”
Reviews.Author: Lola S
Reviews.Content: The staffs were very professional at Hotel Scribe, they all spoke English. Hotel Scribe is located at the Opera Quarter. We stayed four nights; it included full breakfast buffet, i.e..gourmet coffee, juices, array of pastries, cheeses, fruits, hot and cold items. In the afternoon between 2:00 p.m.- 6:00 p.m. tea was served. We ate our dinners at St. Germain (where the locals gathered).La Jacobine and Odeon restaurants ,we would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “I Read All of the reviews and then stayed there....”
Reviews.Author: JPOS_CA
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Scribe is a very nice hotel in an excellent, central Paris location and it is an expensive hotel. We stayed for four nights, but I will stress that you get what you pay and negotiate for. In our case we had two, adjoining Luxury Rooms - club. For 350 euro/night, including an excellent buffet breakfast with full hot and cold options. However the only way we received this rate was emailing the hotel directly and requesting the best rate available for two rooms. And this hotel is expensive, I am sure that some rooms are sub-par but we had a wonderful stay in a very nicely appointed rooms, with excellent beds and good service throughout. Location was excellent, with easy walking to many attractions as well as excellent Metro access minutes away. The hotel also recommended several restaurants which were very good, small local options.

Reviews.Title: “Recent stay at Hotel Scribe”
Reviews.Author: Valerie D
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently located in the centre of Paris. The reception staff are efficient, courteous and the rooms very smart and comfortable. The Hermes toiletries in the room are a treat. The staff are willing to accomodate my requests and could do enough to ensure that my stay was comfortable. it is a business hotel and services like the gym are very limited. I will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “top quality”
Reviews.Author: teddoug
Reviews.Content: Very central,great location, smart,very clean and well maintained, would definitely recommend, great concierge service and all satff very helpful

Reviews.Title: “First time in Paris”
Reviews.Author: autumnmss
Reviews.Content: I planned this trip for almost a year...worked with a travel agent but really had to search myself for hotels. I am very picky about rooms and usually stay in 5 star hotels when I go away. I chose Scribe because I felt it was the best choice for the price and for the location. I would have loved to stay at Crillon or the Ritz, but I needed two rooms for my self and my children (20,17,16).. We chose the club rooms because they were bigger and included the mini bar... Ok well the hotel is lovely, clean and great location... we were there for 9 nights 10 days which is a long time!... The rooms were large, our king size bed and room was large and very nice... my kids room was large twin beds, and we had a spare bed brought up. It was located near alot, we walked to many locations... The restaurants are nice around but very similar...not great. The rooms were cleaned every day (we did tip 30e for each room to make sure we got extra towels and extras). Next the concierge was nice... not extremely helpful but answered our questions when we asked. Franz at the front desk was nasty and rude...when our card didnt work 2 nights in a row he didnt offer to bring my husband up to our room, but then a euro couple had the same problem and he fell over himself to bring them up..(hmmm?) they are extremely nice to euro people..as for americans they are ok, but not extremely nice...maybe they tried with us because we dropped about the cost of a small kia there for a week for the whole stay! The second night we did ask them if the bar was included in the room and they said yes... Later found out that only included soft drinks..nothing else, so we got hit with a big bar bill from the liquer and snacks we had...My main concern was the cleanliness of the room and the size. The Scribe club room is great for that. We didnt eat in the restaurant, but had the breakfast included everyday. It had alot of food and different choices that were very good. The only thing is that once again we had the staring from all the other guests as if we had three heads when we were having breakfast. (what is it Americans in this country?) By the end of the week could care less who stared, and made sure they knew I was American....Anyway I loved our stay in Paris, and definately would go back, but would like to try another hotel comprobable to the Scribe.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous pampering yet child friendly”
Reviews.Author: GRoyer
Reviews.Content: Stayed there 3 nights, with a 2-month old baby. From the door, the service was impeccable, and the 2 doormen very friendly and helpful. Housekeeping service has all the needs for adults as well as children (for example when we requested a baby bath the governant brought a little teddy bear gift for our daughter!). Room service was generous and very good food for the price. Very convenient when you can't be bothered going out again after a long day! Only thing that we found could be improved was the coffee on the breakfast tray - too bitter. Overall fantastic hotel, service and of course great location next to Opera. Looking forward to staying there next time I stay in Paris, specially when you can find a deal on the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible experience...”
Reviews.Author: Andrew B
Reviews.Content: We booked a club room and the only benefit was that we got free soft drinks. The room was tiny and cost €390 per night. This was a shock after being in the US. The sink in the bathroom wouldn't drain, due to the plug not coming up high enough, so we told the front desk and they never fixed it during our 5 night stay. The front desk were generally rude. My wife had a bath one night and the carpet in the bedroom was wet (where my suitcase was laying) because the bath must have leaked through the bathroom wall. We had a buffet breakfast in the hotel one day because nothing around the hotel was open before 8am and we had to pay €32 each! The corridors constantly smelled of cigarette smoke. I wouldn't stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Not exceptionsl...but it is nonetheless quite a good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Johnb8
Reviews.Content: First the location. Indeed it is quite handy to a lot of attractions, though be aware that the area is not QUITE as squeaky clean as some other parts of Paris...and there are a few homeless people scattered about. 'No sense of threat or danger of any kind....but don't expect a complete Disneyland version of Paris, as you might find several blocks to the South, nearer the Seine...or in the 16th. But I have no problem with the area, and would not avoid the hotel on that basis at all. The rooms are very nice...perhaps not full-on 5 star, but quite nice We had the so-called "Deluxe" room, which to honest would be hard to describe as deluxe. "Nice"...or perhaps even "very nice", but not deluxe. The size is adequate, but certainly not roomy. The bed is great, which to be fair is a big part of the hotel experience. 'Nice 42 inch plasma in the room. No real complaints at all....just not over-the-top luxurious. Service is pretty good, though often a bit harried. You get the impression that there aren't enough staff, as it often takes a while for the phone to be answered when you ring downstairs, and they often seem a little stressed. When you do get someone on the phone, they are efficient and helpful. Again, good, but not great. No real problems.....just not that effortless sense of perfect service you might find at what I would consider a TRUE 5 star, like the Crillion. As is so often the case, it comes down to price. If you are paying 300 or 400 Euros, you will be getting good value (for Paris, mind you) and should be quite happy, if not over the moon. If you are being offered rates above 500, I'd opt for one of the true luxury hotels of Paris, which aren't that much more than 500 Euros. I'd be happier at the Scibe at 350 a night than at the Crillion at 600 or 700.........but if the price you're being offered at the Scribe starts creeping up towards 500, you can get more for your money elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Not sure why this is a 5 Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SavannahLady2010
Reviews.Content: The service is so-so, the amenities are lacklustre. For example, I ordered coffee and was told "go to the mini bar area". The safe did not work, the gym closes at 9:30 which is early when you work all day, the hair dryer and coffee machine needs replacing - I know these seem like small inconveniences, but that along with a room that is "ok" but not great, and a location I wouldn't consider one of the best in Paris (if you have been here you will know that there are alot of homeless people in this area, as central as it is, so it doesn't feel as safe as other areas of Paris) I would say this is a 4 star hotel. It's lovely in its way but not 5 star.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Great Hotel at good price”
Reviews.Author: SJW0206
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a very good location and excellent connectivity to all the places of attraction. The Metro station is 5 min away as well as the hop on hop off bus stops. The hotel has great rooms which are very clean and comfortable. Also,they treat you every evening with sweets, chocolates etc and unlike most hotels, actually doesnt charge you for the soft drinks and juices stocked in the fridge. The conceirge is very helpful, and resourceful as well. They guide you well on planning your days out. They also help you arrange for tickets for most of the attractions which is indeed very convenient. Only limiting thing that we found was on choice of food for vegeterians. The hotel has very limited vegeterian menu as well as there is a dearth of good vegeterian restaurants around . However, given the convenient location, one can always travel by MEtro to restaurant places. I will like to stay again at the Hotel, as long as I am able to make some other arrangements for food.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Paris in the spring is gorgeous and our hotel stay made it almost perfect! We thought it was a great location - close to the subway and walking distance to many shops, restaurants and landmarks. We loved our room - it was so nicely appointed and the bathroom was beautiful. The service was great and the conceirge very helpful. We just loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful staff and great location”
Reviews.Author: JJMcQueen
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a relatively quiet location and yet fairly central to lots of Paris's attractions. My wife and I stayed here for 4 nights with some friends. The luxury rooms were very well presented, and very quiet considering we were in France's capital city. The rooms weren't big, but were on par with similar standard hotel rooms of other major city hotels. Mind you, it would be interesting to see the size of the standard rooms. For the first 2 days we had our rooms cleaned twice a day - we even had our bathrobes changed each day. But the last 2 days we never experienced the same service for some reason. The concierge desk staff were fantastic. They went overboard in trying to help you no matter what query you had. They were a credit to the hotel. The hotel also has a 'Tea Cafe' which serves not just lots of variations of tea (obviously!) but the most delightful pastries to accompany them. Just don't think of the calories! We ate in the restaurant 3 nights out of our 4. This was partly due to there being a poor choice of other restaurants within walking distance of the hotel. We celebrated 2 birthdays when we were there, and on both occasions the restaurant served up a cake/ some individual cakes free of charge which was very considerate of them. The restaurant food on the weekday evenings was top class - expensive - but top class. The Saturday night meal was not to the same standard (different menu). Breakfast was first class - couldn't fault the variety of choice. You certainly didn't need lunch if you took advantage of all that was on offer. Only 1 downside was on our last morning one of the staff was hoovering the carpet in the breakfast restaurant whilst we were still eating! Would we go back the Hotel Scribe? Possibly, but we wouldn't stay there at the weekend (it seems to pick itself up during the week to cater for it's business clientele) and we would need to get a taxi in the evening if we wanted a decent restaurant other than the hotel's.

Reviews.Title: “SCRIBE is CLASSY and COMFY”
Reviews.Author: Genghis17
Reviews.Content: Everytime we go to Paris, we stay in Hotel Scribe--we find it one if not the best hotel in Paris--classy and comfy and the location is perfect! Walking distance is LAFAYETTE Mall-which is a haven for shopping; then you have L'OPERA one block away..for great music, and theaters by the back side, on a historic and classic street--few meters away...All the nice restos and boutiques around.... The hotel itself is very historic-having been the site of the first movie ever shown on screen...The Lobby is elegant, good food and reasonable price restaurant , service impeccable (Concierge cheerfully assists in making reservation on shows and take time to find what you like)..and the Salon de The--a fantastic library atmosphere, relaxing tea and drinks lounge with books on shelf at the upper level, on a spiral staircase... We always had a very good time here--and view from our room, although not too high on 6th floor), is very nice indeed! Bonus is a free wifi--:) Great hotel highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at the Hotel Scribe 9/1-4/2011”
Reviews.Author: crusinKate
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Scribe.. everyone was wonderful, the breakfast was delicious.. twice we were there before the room opened since we had trips planned and they opened up just for us! that was just above in the service required.. they had an English paper every morning.. frankly everyone at the Scribe and everyone in Paris were wonderful.. the tea room at the Scribe had delicious pastries and delicious tea... our room at the Scribe was a king bed with a view of the opera house.. the staff was kind.. I cannot say enough about how pleasant, fun and exciting our time at the Scribe was... many people write that hotels such as the Scribe are expensive, but in looking at what one receives it's well worth it, and I indeed feel very lucky to be able to stay at this hotel.. I look forward to going to Paris again and again staying at the Scribe.. it was just wonderful.!!!

Reviews.Title: “20 bug bites after 1 night stay”
Reviews.Author: krintz
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Scribe on 4 October 2011. When I woke up in the morning I had 3 bug bites. As the day progressed, more and more bites appeared on arms, face, feet etc. I was SO grossed out I will never go back again. Emailed the hotel to inform but have not heard back from them. Assuming it was bed bugs after doing some research.

Reviews.Title: “not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: trini69
Reviews.Content: Undoubtedly, splendid location - Near the Opera, and Madelaine, and Gallery Lafayette, and Printemps, and the Concord - everything is in a walking distance. However, the price we paid for the rooms did not correspond to the quality. My room was not spacious, looked a little worn, but the worst was the SMELL. I guess this was a room where smoking was once permitted, but the smell is still there... horrible. Bathroom was very nice, with Hermes toiletries, soft bathrobe - well, everything you could expect from a 5-star hotel. Otherwise, I would say that it's a 4-star hotel in an excellent location, with bad room service :) But then who comes to Paris to eat in?

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Scribe”
Reviews.Author: PZJazz
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, excellent service, well located between the Opera and the Louvre. Near lots of great shopping. Concierge was very helpful with restaurant reservations, touring ideas and more. Buffet breakfast was included in our package and we really enjoyed it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, location - pricey”
Reviews.Author: CLL29
Reviews.Content: The rooms are the largest I've seen in this historic area of Paris. Near the Opera, the location is walking distance to Lourve and many other tourist sites. The food was good.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect position near Opera”
Reviews.Author: JerseyLB
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, more a 4* than a 5* but perfect position for theatres, shops, museums etc.. Rooms are quite spacious but a little bit dated. Beds are SofitelBeds and extremely comfortable. Bar is comfy, they served a good snac menu if you are on your own. Breakfast is a bite pricy but very good, try to book with your breakfast included. Stay in this hotel a few times and I think the street rooms are more noisy. Wifi is free but bit slow.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, great location”
Reviews.Author: cunningtim
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very nice. In a great location, easy walking distance to the Louvre and other attractions. Breakfast buffet was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kayaydee
Reviews.Content: Hotel Scribe is in a perfect location with most attractions being walking distance from the hotel. The staff at reception and the concierge were very friendly and helpful. This is a 5 star hotel and we could not fault it. Even a small error during breakfast was followed by a handwritten note of apology and some sweets. In fact this is the only hotel that has ever emailed us before arrival to make sure the beds were arranged according to how we wanted it. Fabulous Hotel and will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This is a quality hotel in a a first class position. Great service and well appointed rooms which are very quiet resppite being on main roads. If you want to be near the shopping centres and the Opera you would not find a much better place to stay. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in amazing Paris”
Reviews.Author: Moveround
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights at Le Scribe in June this year. Our receptiion was very warm and friendly on arrival and all throughtout our stay. Breakfast was amazing also inicluded in our tariff. Our room was lovely, separate WC, which is great. We had dinner at the hotel on at least 2 occasions and also are in the Tea Rooms. The location was great although we did get lost several tmes in a heavy down pour of rain coming back from Notre Dame. Conceirge could have been a little more helpful but everything else was terrific. As this hotel stay was near the start of our 3 months holiday some of the details are now not so clear but our overall review is that Le Scribe is a great hotel and we have recommended the hotel to all we met as well as our travel agent in Australia.

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant and Memorable Experience.”
Reviews.Author: Mangroo
Reviews.Content: It was our 30 year aniversary so me and my husband decided to renew our vows in Paris. It was our first time visiting so we did not know what to expect. Hotel Scribe made it seemless for us. The concierge email us with answers to all our questions and made recommendations before our arrival into Paris. We were warmly welcome and our stay was Magnifique. I needed a bouquet and a photographer and the concierge arranged it for me though it was short notice. We were quite impressed with the level of service we recieved, for they made our time spent in Paris very memorable. Merci' Hotel Scribe . Looking forward to our next visit ;)

Reviews.Title: “Superb 5* Hotel, we loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Kate J
Reviews.Content: Fantastic, friendly service. Rooms very peaceful, beds are the most comfortable we have ever slept in... at least since we last stayed there 2 years ago. We got an upgrade with a complimentary bottle of champagne, fruit and chocolates and the staff were most professional and attentive (a far better experience than the 5* London hotel we had stayed in the night before). Location is good too - 10 mins walk to Gallerie Layfayette and 15 mins to the Louvre. Eat at Chez Chalet round the corner and you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Bilsy1970
Reviews.Content: After reading the reports on here we booked the Hotel Scribe for a short break. To summarise it was not the best decision we have ever made. We were not wished a pleasant stay on arrival. There was no information about the hotel or the area it was in anywhere. The staff, particulary one lady on reception was one of the rudiest people I have ever met. I have coeliac disease, a wheat and gluten allergy. I emailed the hotel before my stay to see how they could accomadate me but they failed to reply. We ate on the Friday night in the restaurant and I informed them quite clearly with a French translation leafet that I had coeliac disease. The Maitre d' informed me this would not be a problem and then promptly served my starter with bread. They didn't even try to disguise the fact that they had just taken the bread off the dish and brought it back, they didnt remake it..... no apology was received. We were not not asked if we had enjoyed our stay upon departure. It was all round bad service. I really can't be bothered to go in to further detail as I feel the hotel has taken enough of my time already. My partner and I are well travelled and have come across some "bad" hotels but this is the first that has driven me to write a report on tripadvisor. My advice - stay clear!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: lalalatracy
Reviews.Content: Liked this hotel so much, we returned, although the price doubled! Very good location, didn't have to take taxi anywhere, can walk pretty much everywhere. Staff at reception are exceptional & concierge was extremely helpful although some of the staff working night shifts can come across a little rude, Relations manager apologised for this incident at the end of our stay. There was 2 nice bowls of welcome fruits & a welcome letter which is a very nice touch. We had problems with 1 of our rooms however this was resolved on second night (with a little trouble due to mis-communitcation between staff) The rooms are very clean & have very good amenities, dressing gowns, slippers, cotton buds/pads, nail files, shampoo (no conditioner), moisturizer, shower caps etc etc. This year there is free internet which is a bonus as we had to pay last yr, on the down side their room service menu changed, not as good! If i return to Paris again, I will def stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: OzTraveller1952
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay in this hotel and would highly recommend it. The staff were friendly, very helpful and we were made to feel welcome on the two occasions we stayed at the Scribe in July/August. The bed was extremely comfortable, the linen of high quality, the bathroom of an excellent standard, meticulously clean, and with high quality amenities. The Concierge(s) were efficient, knowledgeable and their restaurant recommendations excellent. I have to mention Moustafa in the bar who was lots of fun and made pre dinner drinks for my sister and I on our last night very special. The hotel is well located for shopping and sightseeing and I would not hesitate to return to this hotel. I look forward to returning to the Scribe Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay at Hotel Scribe!”
Reviews.Author: urbanetraveler
Reviews.Content: We just returned from an amazing week long stay at the beautiful Hotel Scribe. Greeted by the warm and gracious staff, we were given champagne and roses in our room. This set the tone for our entire vacation. This historic hotel is truly beautiful and no detail has been spared! Our room was lovely (although not too large) and very quiet, even with a street-side view. Hotel Scribe wins my vote for the most comfortable bed and soft, luxurious linens and towels. Just what a traveler needs after a long journey! The bathroom is well appointed (with Hermes amenities) and the storage is more than ample. A highlight is dining in their exquisite breakfast room which is a treat unto itself. From the flaky croissants (truly unbelievable and worth every single calorie), perfect, fluffy omelets and delicious pain au chocolat, it was a decadent breakfast worth waking up for! Even though the bar is quite pricy, the breakfast is worth every euro. We have traveled throughout the world, staying at some of the most exclusive properties. Hotel Scribe is five star on all levels from its ideal location, luxury accommodations, delicious food and top notch service. It is the perfect boutique hotel near the Opera and in walking distance to the Louvre, Champs Elysee, Fauchon and Galeries Lafayette. Thank you to all of you at the hotel for your warm and most special reception during our stay in Paris. We will certainly return to the hotel and highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: HolidayDad2004
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, lovely rooms and a great location. However, drinks in he bar are ridiculously expensive and don't even think of having breakfast unless you've robbed a bank first.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: lulu90
Reviews.Content: Club level offers free internet. Rooms are average size.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: homeless53
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this wonderful hotel during our Christmas holidays 2010 and loved the place. It is ideally situated close to the opera and the Galeries Lafayette and within walking distance of the Louvre. The staff were always helpful and friendly and full of good advice and ideas. Make sure you include breakfast as it is the best hotel breakfast I have ever had.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, super rooms”
Reviews.Author: John C
Reviews.Content: Hotel with a history and a tradition they live up to! Great location - walking distance to Opera House and shopping district. Room was super - bed was outstanding. Bathroom was spacious & well equipped. Breakfast was outstanding Staff were excellent. What more to say?

Reviews.Title: “The Best So Far!”
Reviews.Author: Imahori
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Scribe for 2 nights in June. It was an amazing and wonderful stay. The size of room was just right, nicely decored and comfortable. In Paris, a brand name guarantee nothing, I did have quite a lot of terrible experience at some of the Luxury Hotels. However, Hotel Scribe did reflect the Sofitel Standard- Clean & Comfortable Room+Friendly & Attentive Services! As a hotelier, my expectations are certainly quite high. I guarantee Hotel Scribe provides you want you want and beyond what you expect. Come and experience yourself!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: The_bald_gourmet
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay in the center of Paris within walking distance of the Opera, Rue de Rivoli, the Louvre and many other sites as well as being close to several Metros then this hotel is a great choice. My room was excellent. Spacious for a room in Paris, quiet and on a floor whose walls were lined with floor to ceiling pictures of Josephine Baker! Each floor has an "icon" on which its decor is built that creates a real sense of being in Paris rather than a "cookie cutter" hotel that could be anywhere in the world. The bathroom was also terrific and the whole place is kept immaculately clean. If you are looking for a hotel that is focused on business travel then this may not be the one for you as you won't find a huge business center and the other services that go with hotels focused on the business traveler. The concierge was very helpful and the room service staff were terrific. Overall a really excellent find!

Reviews.Title: “Professional hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Larry039
Reviews.Content: Classic hotel in a classic city. Check in was swift & she noted my birthday had been the day before so gave us 2 free drinks in the bar which was a nice touch on arrival! Room was nice, again a classic set up for a city centre hotel. I felt the room may have been a smoking room once upon a time but they assured me it was a non smoking room. Anyway I didn't make a fuss about it. Breakfast was excellent with a large buffet spread, perfect to get the day started. Small shame it is in the basement though, a view in a different city is always nice. All round good, would come again.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel, definitely worth staying”
Reviews.Author: JudithChalmers09
Reviews.Content: Good location....good value.....great rooms.....done.

Reviews.Title: “Tres Chic”
Reviews.Author: wilko87
Reviews.Content: This is truly a 5 star hotel even a bit snooty but well worth a stay. The location is close to all the major sights in Paris. We only had breakfast on the 3 days we stayed there but it was all you could desire. All the staff were very helpful and made you welcome. The rooms are very well set up with a largish bath room (with sound from the TV) and the bed was very comfortable with a choice of pillows They also have free internet . Would recommend wilko87

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: Josephine01Sydney
Reviews.Content: Great location, stunning hotel with lovely warm welcoming staff on the front desk and I must mention the very charming guest relations manager too. This is a true five star hotel and we will certainly be staying here whenever we visit Paris in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, great staff, except for the ghost . .”
Reviews.Author: Armida1969
Reviews.Content: What really makes a great hotel are comfortable beds and the staff. The staff was professional and very helpful. The beds felt like one was sleeping on clouds. But . . . , my sister swears our room (#531) was haunted. She insisted that she kept seeing an old soldier sitting on the chair by the desk.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: maratom
Reviews.Content: We are currently at the Hotel Scribe with 2 more days left. I cannot say enough good things. We arrived at 9am and were given 2 of our 3 rooms - remarkable and much needed for our weary children from the overnight flight from the US. The rooms are spacious by European standards and very well appointed. Beds and pillows are super comfortable. The staff bent over backwards to accommodate us - brought a roll away bed immediately for my daughter, stored my mother's prescription medicine for her (needed refrigeration) and the hotel was perfect with room servicing (twice a day), cookies and chocolates left in your room each afternoon, plenty of towels, robes, etc... The locations is very convenient - metro about one block away. The concierge is very helpful, English is spoken by the staff and restaurant waiters. Breakfast is a bit pricey (32 euros) but it is a good variety of food and tasty and children eat free. It is also very quick in the morning - buffet style. This is a great hotel! Oh and free wi-fi too! We have been very pleased with the hotel and the service and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel; Great staff.”
Reviews.Author: rbgrouper6
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Scribe in May 2011. This hotel is beautiful, comfortable and friendly. We arrived at around 2PM local time and our room was not ready yet, but we were escorted over to the bar area and given a free glass of wine for whle we waited. We waited less than an hour. The Hotel is close enough to many sights that you can walk, but there is Metro stop very near the hotel that makes it easy to get anywhere. Our room was lovely and super comfortable (especially the bed). The bathroom was great, with a shower , a separate tub, and the toilet in a separate room off the entrance hallway. We asked the hotel if they could help us find a place for a great Parisian romantic dinner, and they sent us to the most wonderful resteraunt. A taxi ride from the Hotel to CDG airport was only 43.00 Euros on a Sunday morning. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Can't say enough good things about this hotel”
Reviews.Author: borisbear45
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Scribe for our 25th wedding anniversary and we thoroughly recommend it. Firstly, location, it was a stone's throw away from the Opera House, Galeries Lafayette and a short walk from the Champs Elysees, so a great location for shopping and touring. We were welcomed very warmly by all the staff who couldn't do enough for us, even awarding us 'guests of the day' status which meant an upgrade to a suite, complimentary breakfasts and cocktails at the bar. They were helpful and charming throughout our stay and made us feel very special. Our room was chic and elegant, very well appointed and immaculate throughout. The bathroom was, again, spotless and very modern with some nice touches like the magnifying makeup mirror and extras like slippers, robe, nail files, cotton buds etc and, of course, top of the range toiletries and fluffy towels. The room was cleaned to an extremely high standard throughout our stay and we loved coming back from a day's sightseeing to a complimentary bottle of champagne and pastries. Although the room fronted a busy road, there was no traffic noise and we slept really well. Breakfast was excellent and the service was also very smooth in lovely surroundings with silver tableware. The spa was our one disappointment as we had expected to have a jacuzzi together, hot tub style, only to find it was basically a bath jacuzzi in each of the mens and ladies changing rooms so we didn't bother. The hotel communal areas were stylish and immaculate and the hotel had an elegant but warm ambience that we loved. We had a wonderful stay at this hotel and felt that the staff really cared about us. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “horrible rip off”
Reviews.Author: TXmermaid
Reviews.Content: Upon check in we were told we were being upgraded with free mini bar. Upon check out we were told this does not include alcohol and other items and they insisted upon payment. There are too many good hotels to be subjected to this type of service. If they were reputable they would have trusted the customer and not allowed them to leave with a bad taste. We will never come back there again.

Reviews.Title: “You are paying for Location”
Reviews.Author: madrews
Reviews.Content: This hotel is unbeatable for location as you are across the street from Opera and 2 short blocks from Les Grands Magazins. However, the five star rating stops there. For the price charged, breakfast (meager as their buffet is) should be included, the free internet is slow, we had problems with the TV, and the room is the size of a postage stamp. The concierge also forgot to make the required wakeup call that she had suggested to us. Thank goodness we left the blinds open to let the morning light wake us. However, the staff are helpful and I will say that their response time to difficulties was exceptionally quick.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great location, get Club Level!”
Reviews.Author: Barbara M
Reviews.Content: Just returned from the Scribe and loved the hotel. Beds are very comfortable, the room is extremely well-designed in a classic modern style with a french flair, and so so quiet because of great double-paned terrace doors. We had a club room which gets you a late checkout (we stayed til 4pm! ) free wireless (which can run you $30 day elsewhere) and also little fun treats in the room- including cookies, Moet Chandon, and flowers! So fun. The hotel is so conveniently located just a block from the opera, a few blocks from Place Vendome, shopping, metro, etc. Service was excellent throughout the hotel, from housekeeping to the concierge to the front desk. An excellent choice and a great value too.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a super location”
Reviews.Author: Jules32033
Reviews.Content: I and my wife stayed here in may from a Thursday to Sunday. We had a club room overlooking Rue Scribe with the magnificent Opera Garnier building in sight from our balcony. The hotel is in a brilliant central location within walking distance of all the major sites. Our room was superb and the staff were extremely helpful. The only negative point was the exorbitant cost of food and beverages in the bar and restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: Spectacles007
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at this hotel several times and finally decided to make the effort to write a review. I love everything about this hotel, the location which is right in the heart of Paris 2 min walk to the Opera( huge opera fan) and close to all the attractions. We travel by Eurostar and you can walk to the hotel if , like us don't carry too much luggage , by taxi it takes about 10 min ride from Gare du Nord The Cafe Lumiere inside the hotel serves magnifique food ,although there are plenty bistro places around if you find it expensive. The hotel is absolutely spotless , which we found very unlikely for an old hotel in the middle of Paris , even for 5*.(the hotel across the room hello!!) I also enjoyed the very attentive turn down service where you return to your room to find it spotless , cool and the radio tuned on a very romantic channel. Love it!

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: A beautiful hotel in a great location. Perfect location if catching Roissy Bus from CDG. All staff members were very attentive. We had a lovely room overlooking Rue Scribe. Would have liked a bigger wardrobe! Very comfortable bed. I will definitely consider this hotel on my next trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in the perfect location and had friendly, helpful staff. The concierge was extremely patient and gave us great restaurant recommendations. Everywhere they sent us was delicious and a good value. It was a bit pricey for relatively small rooms, but it was cozy and very modern. The bar and restaurant were overpriced, but that is to be expected for a hotel in Paris. Overall, I would recommend this hotel to friends traveling to Paris for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great service, but cost a little high”
Reviews.Author: irbflyfish
Reviews.Content: The location, near the opera house. The staff was great, but typical small room found in Paris. The price was a high, but then again, we were in Paris, not known for its great value on hotel rooms. The attached spa is very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent (expensive) hotel”
Reviews.Author: ChrisCumbria
Reviews.Content: Excellent in all respects, but expensive. The food and drink was well overpriced but there are many places close by to eat. I thought that 35 Euros each for breakfast was over the top, so we ended up eating nearby at a fraction of the price.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury in Central Paris”
Reviews.Author: TimoLancs
Reviews.Content: Beautiful, elegant hotel in the centre of Paris, and just around the corner from The Palais Garnier. Wonderful location surrounded by many patiseries, bars and restaurants. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JeffreyAC
Reviews.Content: After moving to the Hotel Scribe from another Paris hotel, we nearly had everything we wanted. Fantastic service, gorgeous comfortable room and ammenities. Only problem was the bar/restaurant seemed to be grossly expensive. We had "reasonable" drink prices in the bar across the street at the Intercontinental.

Reviews.Title: “Truely Amazing!!! 5 Star Service & Quality All Round”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived we were greeted by warm and friendly staff who made us feel very welcome. The check-in service was rather straight forward and our room was ready shortly after an early "am" arrival. The room was amazing and had all the amenities you would expect from a 5 Star Luxury hotel. What really made this hotel unique was the friendly staff who may i say spoke fluent English and furthermore were happy to assist with any request. The location of the hotel is ideal for travellers wanting to stay out of the hustle and bustle of tourist zones yet close enough to walk to any major tourist location. i highly recommend to all and sure to stay here again on my next visit. Thank you “Scribe hotel” for making our stay so special.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location. Super Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Msoree Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel, quiet rooms, very central location between Place de la Madeleine and Opéra with Louvre and Musée d'Orsay at 15mins walking distance. Everything super. Extremely friendly staff. Bar is too expensive though.

Reviews.Title: “Small but luxurious. Great location.”
Reviews.Author: LondonPenguinGirl
Reviews.Content: The service was great here. The first room they showed us to smelled a little of cigarette smoke, the bell boy called down to reception and they moved us immediately to another room just down the corridor. The room was very small but luxurious. Perfect location, very close to shopping, restaurants and some bars. No complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Second visit, some issues”
Reviews.Author: Jart_7
Reviews.Content: Hmmm, we stayed here previously and enjoyed a great experience. This time was similar but we found some small issues worth noting. On this occasion we booked through Eurostar and got a great price deal. However this brought us to a much smaller room (quite tiny) with an inside view. Unfortunately, after the first night I was ready to leave - the bed was awful, lumpy and tipping down at one corner and the bathroom full of black hairs. I presented myself at reception and explained about the bed problem. The young man looked surprised, suggested that this was not the case, and asked me what I thought he might do???? I was a little surprised at this as it really wasn't my problem to solve. Either fix the bed or move us - not rocket science. He said he could not make that decision and would have to look into it, could we come back later to find out? Rather than "get into it" in reception we agreed to come back at 6 for a decision, breaking up our day unnecessarily. We were moved, packing up our own bags, to a new room with a suitable bed. Sad though, we shouldn't have to faff around like that in this class of hotel. Also, we found the bar staff exceptionally slow in comming to our table - they seemed more intent in chatting to each other, rearranging the bar area and shuffling chairs than taking an order. We walked out on two occasions.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location, great price, lovely decor, superb design”
Reviews.Author: kowkowzeiss
Reviews.Content: Three nights. Checkin smooth, good English command. Courteous and professional. Warm and helpful. Room was a delight, small, queen bed only but very luxurious nonetheless. Feels new and recently renovated. Somewhat obviously, esp bathroom, not using the best fittings available (cheap marble etc) but the bedroom itself absolutely no complaints. Loved the design. Bed luxurious comfortable. Concierge also extremely helpful 10/10. Helped booked several hard to get restaurants despite getting nowhere after a few. Walking distance to Printemps, Hermes St Honore and Chanel etc. Walked to Musee d'Orsay. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Truly a FIVE Star”
Reviews.Author: Phillytravler1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here and booked a luxury club room. Decent size room for Paris and had all the luxuries one would expect with a five star. Great service, incredibly clean, and all the little extras. I enjoyed the sweets handed out every afternoon. I cannot say enough about this hotel and I would highly recommend it to anyone looking for something special and would like to take the guess work out of researching a hotel. As many have indicated, the hotel is in a great location. Plenty of restaurants, shopping and a couple of Metro stops nearby. If you have time, the steam room in the spa are quite nice and incredibly clean with an extremely friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “J'aime hotel Scribe!”
Reviews.Author: tvizz
Reviews.Content: It was our first trip to Paris and my husband is very picky so I figured we'd be safe going with a Sofitel chain and we were not disappointed. We were able to take a bus from the airport that dropped us off right by l'Opera which meant a short walk down the street to the hotel. They upgraded us to a beautiful, but tight, room. We had doors that opened up so we could peek outside and get some nice fresh air. The beds were comfortable and the room was clean. We also like to workout to combat jet lag so we used their fitness centre every morning. It was a very small, but clean room with one treadmill, one bike and one elliptical. It was a bit crowded some mornings. The location is fantastic - a 2 minute walk to Galleries Lafayette (beautiful mall/dept store), right by the metro and walking distance to most attractions (about a 30-40 minute walk to the Eiffel Tower). There are some great cafes right around the corner where you can grab breakfast - or a small grocery store to stock up on some beverages. There is even a Starbucks right around the corner. The staff was kind and we really enjoyed our stay. The only negative was the shower was awkward and leaked a lot of water because of the way the showerhead was directed. We will be returning in the spring because we loved it so much!

Reviews.Title: “New Years Eve in Hotel Scribe Paris”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic weekend in Paris, thanks to the very welcoming atmosphere in the Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very bad experiment”
Reviews.Author: jphk
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my family in December 2010 with 3 bedrooms for 8 days. CLUB SOFITEL DELUXE room. - The rooms are small and the bathrooms too. - Internet was confirmed in my price was not available in my room, cable or connection was broken. After the visit of two technicians two days I finally get connected. - There was dust on the desktop background. - I had a service which provided CLUB SOFITEL "sweets/mignardises" daily and the newspaper every morning, I received the newspaper once, and "sweets" twice that of dry madelaine my kids do not want. - Some people at the reception are poorly educated, especially a certain "François" I advise you to avoid absolutely. It is almost haughty and rude, you cross the floor and has nothing to do in this hotel. Very unpleasant person. - Breakfast is expensive but good, except the bread which is very hard, harm, with many good bakeries in Paris. - Bad surprise on returning to my country, I was charged of 1.425 euros more for a second stay at this hotel that we had not yet confirmed! Unjustified and done without my permission. I asked for explanations.

Reviews.Title: “Recomend”
Reviews.Author: HolidayJunkie99
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over New Year. Very helpful staff. Was upgraded, which was nice. Large room, nicely furnished. Clean and bright. Medium sized bathroom, brand new. Didn't use the restaurant or bar but they looked like they lacked atmosphere. But location is great, very close to big department stores and Place Vendome. Concierge helpful with restaurant reservations etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, charming hotel but beware of bar prices!”
Reviews.Author: moonling Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Charming hotel with quirkier decor than some - we liked the style of the lobby and bar. Fab location close to major department stores, Opera and the beautiful Place Vendôme. We were given a free drink at the bar, but wouldn't have bought another if we'd known it was 41 euros for a single malt and a vodka and coke! Nice room, big enough for us, flatscreen tv, bathrobes and nice toiletries. As said before, the beds are very comfortable. Our room was very clean and was cleaned each day, although we found the tea and coffee making facilities limited and unreplenished. The staff were helpful enough when you asked them to asvise you and all spoke fluent English. We'd stay here again, but still wouldn't be ordering any rounds of drinks at those prices...

Reviews.Title: “Very considerate”
Reviews.Author: croakies
Reviews.Content: Standard classic Paris hotel in the 4-5 Star category. Room was small but bed was great. We had a late flight out and they allowed us to stay in the room until 3pm with no extra charge which I thought was very considerate! Only nightmare was trying to get a taxi!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience!! I will return.”
Reviews.Author: 24shoregirl
Reviews.Content: I was a solo traveler in September, in Paris to attend a week-long class. I found The Scribe because it is managed by Sofitel (I have had great experiences at their hotels in NY and LA). I have been to Paris many times, and was fortunate to stay in several 5-star "palace hotels". This was the first time I was visiting Paris alone and I was a little apprehensive. This is a very special hotel and I had an excellent stay. It is cheaper than the more famous, 5-star hotels, but The Scribe's service and amenities are certainly equal to any I have experienced. The room was lovely and the view was delightful. I think it would be very romantic. The street sounds were completely blocked by the windows. The toiletries are Hermes, the towels are soft and the bed was very comfortable. My ONE complaint: the closet was very small. I had room service, and used the bellmen, the laundry service, the concierge and the business center. From the pleasant front desk check-in to the check-out. I experienced warm, professional, highly competent service. The one problem I had with my television was solved promptly with no fuss or waiting. As a single woman traveling alone, I felt secure at all times in this hotel. The location is perfect, between the Opera and La Madeleine Church, great shopping is everywhere and the Louve is 10 minutes away. . I highly recommend this hotel to any traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: BanajiMumbai
Reviews.Content: We checked out of the disgusting Hotel Napoleon (near the Etoile in Paris) and moved into this sanctuary of calm cleanliness located near the opera Paris. i had visited this hotel as a child.. 40 years ago it was regarded as one of the top hotels in the city..and I am happy to say that it is still up there.The check in was flawless. our room was spic and span.. the toileteries were hermes.. the staff unfailingly polite.The conciegers were particularly helpful - especially after my wife's wallet was stolen in the metro..The hotel is expensive - but I would stay here again in the blink of an eye.

Reviews.Title: “4-stars hotel at 5-stars prices”
Reviews.Author: Alex_Sb
Reviews.Content: Interior design of the room, especially bathroom gives an impression of 3-, maximum 4-stars hotel. Rooms are clean, but cheap-looking. Location is very good: 5 minutes walk to Boulevard Haussmann (Galeries Lafayette and Au Printemps), 3-4 minutes walk to nearest metro.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Paris”
Reviews.Author: JWLMontgomery_AL
Reviews.Content: The Scribe was the perfect hotel for a week in Paris to celebrate my birthday. Great location in the Opera area. We arrived in Paris early and were able to check into our room by 9am. Service was excellent. Linda at the Concierge desk was fabulous. Rooms were spacious and comfortable with extraordinary bed. Would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, good for Americans”
Reviews.Author: Heynow007
Reviews.Content: The Opera section, to me, is the best part of town and Hotel Scribe is in the center of it all. I got stranded in Paris (sounds horrible, huh?) when the Iceland Volcano errupted April 2010 and I found this hotel on Priceline for around 225 Eur/night. I've been to Paris about 10+ times on business and this is the first time I found a hotel that I absolutely loved. Clean rooms, quiet atmosphere that is right in the middle of a very good neighborhood with good nightlife and Restaurants. I titled it "Good for Americans" because it is. I am used to Hiton, Marriott chains and this reminds me of their rooms; a little smaller, but a little nicer. I can't emphasize "clean" enough when it comes to Paris and "spacious" is another term that should be used for a Parisian hotel. I've been in some very "French" hotels with beds that slump in the middle, dirty carpets, dirty showers, etc. and this place is very good. I stayed alone, but I'd say it is perfect for a couple. You should be warned that the L'Opera section of Paris is very pricey and this hotel is expensive at times. I paid $20 for 1 drink in the restaurant, but I have to say, it was very good. If you want less expensive, then go to Montparnasse or the Latin Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed in club room. Very spacious by...”
Reviews.Author: sergpro
Reviews.Content: Stayed in club room. Very spacious by Parisienne standards. Club level does not have a bar it just means the soft drinks are included in your rate. Concierge is good. Very quiet. Located next to wonderful bistros and cafes. Do not eat at the hotel it is overpriced and not a true reflection of Parisienne cuisine. Do not get the breakfast for Eur32 each- completely not worth it. Everything else - wonderful. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but service could be "better"”
Reviews.Author: Bergentravel81
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a superb location, and the guys at belldesk are great and go all the way. The reception staff is a bit stiff, and try to give the best service, but its a little cold and it might have served them well to see how the really great hotelstaffers do it.. The same goes for the conciergie, but they were stressed due to loads of customers, so I give them that as an excuse. They fixed a wheelchair for my girlfriend, and that was great. The juniorsuite was nice, but nothing more than what one would except from a 5 star hotel. They should have a little more amenities. I do hate that there is not free internet access and not free mini-bar. At least the internet is REALLY annoying. Central Europe needs to understand that you can't charge for that in 2010. Its a good hotel, and ok value, so if you get a good price, go :-)

Reviews.Title: “One block from Gallerie Lafayette”
Reviews.Author: micsylim
Reviews.Content: Love the luxury and the location. Bit pricey thou!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and concierge, reasonable hotel but NOT 5 Star”
Reviews.Author: AJ00174
Reviews.Content: The location is great just around the corner from the Opera and the Metro. The area is not too busy and not too quiet either. We had a confirmed early arrival of 12 noon but our rooms were not ready until 2:30pm. They should not confirm it if they can't deliver. There was a feeble attempt from the guest services manager to offer champagne but it did not ever materialise. The rooms were quite good - a little small given that they were meant to be the larger luxury rooms. The aircon did not work particularly well. The bathrooms are nice but toilet is in a seperate room which is much too small and not ventilated well enough. The restuarant is fairly limited - better to go out even if just over to the Cafe du la Paix at the intercontinental (we had 2 good meals there). Breakfast was good - some have commented on it being expensive, but note that they don't charge for children. The concierge staff were GREAT - very helpful and thorough.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy luxury”
Reviews.Author: EvB
Reviews.Content: What a pleasant surprise! Hotel Scribe is my new favourite hotel in Paris. It is a luxury hotel in a great location. It is not cheap but we went with the idea to spoil ourselves for our wedding anniversary and wasn't disappointed. The accommodated our 2.5 year old daughter very well and the service was great. Breakfast was delicious, something for everyone and the most wonderful pastries. The staff on Sunday morning was a little slower than the day before, but that is a minor flaw. We had a room facing the inner courtyard and it was so quiet, we didn't even hear footsteps in the hall. The beds are really good quality. We ordered room service and the food came within 30 minutes. We really enjoyed our dinner - they have a kids menu and overall the portions were quite big. We walked to Museum D'Orsay in 20 minutes, the Opera House is also just around the corner of the hotel. So is Printemps and the Galleries Lafayette - ideal for shopping! We drove to Paris and just a warning - parking is very expensive in this area. 35€ per night.

Reviews.Title: “great location & nice beds!”
Reviews.Author: lalalatracy
Reviews.Content: We took taxi from Gare du Nord to Hotel Scribe, it was a quick journey & cost around 15€ check in was efficient & staff were friendly, bad thing is room is not ready til 2pm Location is good, walking distant to Lafayette, which is fantastic because the shops will deliver your shopping there! We had lunch at the LE CAFE LUMIERE whilst finishing off some work & waiting for the room, they served lovely food & cakes! Would highly recommend. Room & bathroom are a nice size, the bed, although a little too small was very comfortable, I was tempted to buy the pillows! Everything was very clean, shower is brilliant, dressing gown, slippers, cotton buds, cotton pads, hair dryer, shower caps etc. are all provided, they even have Hermes shower gel, shampoo & body lotion, but they don't have conditioner! We used the concierge a lot, almost every day, they are very knowledgeable & friendly. I would advise not to book taxis through concierge as it cost around 5€ more then just getting a cab from Intercontinental across the road! We had room service twice as we got back really late, the food is lovely & fresh, everything was presented perfectly. I would stay again if returning to Paris as the only bad thing is internet is not complimentary & they do not have hair conditioner, but everything else was great.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and Very Comfortable Rooms”
Reviews.Author: kretchy
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Paris, France so I wanted to stay with a reconized brand that I was comfortable with. The reviews were for the most part pretty positive. I have to say the rooms were very nice and comfortable and plenty big. The bathoom were clean and modern. The shower is a few feet off the ground, so that was kind of weird. It almost feels like you are looking down on the bathroom or on stage :) The hotel was pefectly located right near the Opera house and close to public transportion. The staff was very friendly and helpful. I recommend high tea in the cafe! The pastries were excellent! The only negative would be the contintental breakfast downstairs was overpriced for the amount of food offered. But, that is almost expected in hotels. There was a great cafe down the street that was both authentic and well priced. Overall, I would stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, huge rooms for Paris, comfortable beds and clean!”
Reviews.Author: jmariko
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Scribe for our honeymoon and were very impressed with the hotel. It is comparable to a 4 star hotel in the states. It was in a great location in a quieter side of Paris but was within walking distance to cafe's, restaurants and shopping. There is a metro stop a few blocks away that can take you to the main tourist areas (eiffel tour, etc.). The concierge was very helpful in suggesting places to eat, how to use public transportation, getting us a cab, etc. We booked this hotel based on previous tripadvisor ratings - the room and bathroom was very large (especially for european standards) and all of the amenities were clean, modern and classy. The beds were especially comfy. We appreciated having coffee/tea available in the room and were pleasantly surprised by the chocolate and champagne that was waiting for us upon our arrival at no extra charge. I would definitely stay at Hotel Scribe again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Little Luxury Hotel in the Heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: NYC304
Reviews.Content: I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at the Hotel Scribe. Having been disappointed by my last stay at the InterContinental across the street, I switched to the Hotel Scribe. Although much smaller than the InterCon, it is still a medium to large sized hotel but it feels much smaller and more intimate than that. The lobby is elegant and the staff was always extremely kind and helpful. I was upgraded at check-in to an "executive room". While still quite petite by international standards (less so by Parisian standards), the room was beautifully designed with luxurious little finishes and altogether lovely. It might be a little tight for two people with large suitcases but it was more than enough for one person and two with small suitcases would be fine. The bathroom in this room type had both a shower and a separate tub (I heard that not all of them have both) and the toilet in a separate closet-like room. The bed, as usual at Sofitel, was blissfully comfortable! I also hosted a meeting there and, while the food and service were perfect, I didn't like the fact that the meeting rooms are below ground and don't have any natural light - but most people won't be dealing with meetings and such.

Reviews.Title: “It was nice, friendly staff, great concierge!”
Reviews.Author: anasfinds
Reviews.Content: The breakfast was pricey even for Paris standards but other than that, this is a great place to stay. Close to the metro, the opera, place vendome, etc. The toiletries are Hermes (great fringe benefit) I would say compared to the Intercontinental in London this is a 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable hotel with the best location”
Reviews.Author: mikik85
Reviews.Content: the location is ideal. the staff at the reception is very welcoming and helpful. the luxury club room was not big enough but cozy.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Luxury”
Reviews.Author: KLAMK
Reviews.Content: Just after our marriage we travelled to Paris and stayed at the Scribe. We had a wonderful stay. The location of the hotel is perfect and you can very easily get to all the main attractions of the city. The hotel itself has the two most important qualities namely carachter and luxury. The staff was very helpful and professionel. We can warmly recommend the Sribe to newly weds and everybody else.

Reviews.Title: “Traditional Parisienne Style”
Reviews.Author: abcdeLondon
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a business trip, very nice. The rooms are quite grand and well equipped, with the bathroom and the bed being superb. The staff are very pleasant and the service good, although a little 'relaxed' in the bar. The hotel has a fantastic cafe at the front, which includes a lovely patisserie, worth trying. It's quite expensive, but they do offer good corporate rates. The location is dependent on what you are doing in the city, but it is very close to the Opera House which is spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, nice location--but rooms slightly small”
Reviews.Author: zwgc2
Reviews.Content: Spent a night at the Hotel Scribe "Club" room in June as I was going to watch the French Open. The location of the hotel is close to several metro stations including Opera, and the Louvre is within walking distance. The room itself was slightly small, and the flat screen TV slightly small as well. The bathroom is nicely appointed but it is a weird design when the toilet is situated inside a narrow "box", separated from the bathroom. The hotel staff was friendly and helpful, providing us with travel suggestions and transportation recommendations. All in all a very nice hotel but bear in mind of the small room sizes.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing hotel”
Reviews.Author: lavenderUk
Reviews.Content: The location of hotel is very close to the very busy Galleries Lafayette (shopping district) and therefore traffic noise from street outside constant. Also if you like me, enjoy scenic views, this location definitely does not fit the bill. I would not choose this hotel on this basis alone again, but other issues compounded this decision. The exterior or the hotel is pleasant enough, however the inside lacks charm and elegance. The lobby was unimpressive and boring at the least, with horrible dark green sofas. The bedroom had no real day light and was painted in a sombre light ashen grey, which I found quite depressing and made the room appear even smaller than it was. The accent accessories such as pictures and lamps were insipid and uninteresting. The hanging storage space was an ironing cupboard, and the toilet area was so small that with the door closed it felt like a prison cell. Air conditioning not working in room, hot water not working on 1st day also not working, and a second notice came through on 2nd day that hot water would be off from 2-5 that day in whole of Paris. Housekeeping was cordial and did sort out hot water on first evening. I would site these issues as unacceptable for a hotel with a 5 star rating as well as highly annoying. I found the front/desk reception mostly unhelpful. As mentioned Cupboard hanging space small, with about 6 hangers would be okay for a business trallever, both not a couple. Bath is not very practical for people who would struggle to get out of bath as steep drop to floor when stepping out of bath. Breakfast seriously overpriced in hotel (approx 35 Euros per person) and we had to go out to eat, no restaurants nearby the hotel as other guests have commented, so needed to walk a fair distance to find somewhere reasonable. Room service, no special attention to detail as other hotel, for example, turn beds down, chocolates on pillow etc. This hotel is overpriced, impersonal and service not at all up to standard. I would not stay here again. I stayed at the Hotel du Louvre 2 years before and although the hotel was slightly dated, at least staff was courteous and helpful, the ambience was pleasant and it had much more of a personal touch and an old worldly touch of glamour and style you would expect form visiting one of the most opulent and lavish cities in the world.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel within a 15 minute walk of most sights”
Reviews.Author: hmarti24
Reviews.Content: Hotel Scribe is a reasonably priced and comfortable hotel within walking distance of the Louvre and very close to shopping. Galeries Lafayette and a multitude of shops are a 3 minute walk down the street. It is easy to hop on the train from the hotel, but keep in mind that the hotel is in a busy part of the city. This is not a quaint or boutique hotel, but it provides a nice stay if you aren't looking for that kind of experience. If you want a fast paced trip to Paris at a reasonably priced hotel this is a good option. The rooms are clean, comfortable and nicely appointed. The staff was generally nice and helpful. They have a charming cafe overlooking the street, but it was closed every time we attempted to dine there. I most likely will not return to Hotel Scribe, but that is solely due to my preference for smaller boutique hotels in quieter areas. Our stay can be described as "fine." However, I would not discourage someone from staying at the hotel if this is the location and experience they were looking for.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant hotel with a few disappointments!”
Reviews.Author: holiday-lover27
Reviews.Content: We began our trip to France & the UK at The Scribe. We arrived in a private transfer car ( ATS shuttle service - fantastic service from CDG for 55Euro) at the hotel , had our bags quickly carried inside, check-in quite fast and pleasant. Our room was a very pleasant luxury room with a nice opening pair of french doors with a lovely view of the street - very pretty - especially at night. The bed was very plush and comfy. The bathroom was a bit of a surprise only because of the small size, especially for this grade of room - but it was adequate and very clean. There was not much wardrobe space if you wanted to hang your clothes - I took out the nice plush robes so we could fit at least a few of our things into the robe. Overall the room was very enjoyable and comfortable. The other parts of the hotel were also very elegant and pleasant.
