We were , however ,a bit disappointed with the Restaurant - very expensive and very little choice. We felt like we were out of place when we could only have a main and some mineral water! ( very small quantities, very trendy sort of food). Breakfast was also a great expensive at 32euros and we felt a bit isolated as no staff came to help or explain what was on offer - we therefore only had it the first day and opted for room service the other days as this was a much cheaper option. We tried to get lunch the next day but apparently 2:00 was too late. We found it very hard to find any reasonable cafes in that area. Ended up spending too much on what we would consider to be a very mediocre meal - but it is Paris after all. After the Scribe we had an apartment on I'le ST Louis and the food situation there was far different - a very lovely part of Paris! The other problem that we felt at this hotel is that the staff were a bit standoffish and superior . Also you have to pay for internet which is a shame in this day and age when even travellers like to keep in touch with home by email! Overall our experience was very pleasant even though at first we thought we might starve there! The location was quite good for Opera Garnier and the wonderful La Fayette Department Store. I don't think we would stay there again but rather choose somewhere where food is more affordable and accessible.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: swmasson
Reviews.Content: Hotel Scribe was a lovely hotel in a great location... I took my girlfriend to paris to make my proposal... Hotel scribe conceirge were extremely helpful in pre-organising flowers, chocolates, gurmet picnic, champagne, etc - They even had the picnic delivered to Luxemburg gardens for me... Unfortunatly the driver turned up nearly 30 mins late and they forgot to pack the wine, luckily i already bought some champagne for the picnic anyways, so no major issue... Also, that evening i asked conceirge to book us into a nice restaurant for the special occasion, nothing too formal though as we wanted a nice romantic relaxing eveing, they booked us in to "La Truffiere", absolutly lovery restaurant with an amazing menu, would have been good to know the pricing first though, as a 458 EURO food bill was a litle more than we are used to... I did try some 30 year old cheese though!! Even though we went for an executive room, they were still quite small, but i guess thats normal for a hotel in paris, the cost is quite high for what you get, but i guess you are paying for the location... The rooms were clean and nicely decorated, the beds are very comfortable, just as you would expect from a sofitel (They are renound for the comfy beds)... We never ate in the hotel although the area looked very nice, i mean, who travels to paris and eats in a hotel anyways, there were so many nice restaurants and cafe's within walking distance! Although we really enjoyed our stay here, i think you could get better value for money at other hotels in the same area - But if money is not an issue, and you want a safe bet - I would definatly recommend this hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Service, Average Room”
Reviews.Author: StephenA30
Reviews.Content: I'm just back from a 6 night stay at the Scribe with my Partner and 5 month old son. In general we were very happy with the hotel and had a good to very good experience. On the plus side: location; staff (especially guest relations and bell boys); common areas downstairs beautiful; food. On the negative: price (both room rate and food prices were very very high); room (big on 6th floor but no view and not much of a real 5* feeling - no wow factor in the room); cleaning service was just okay (room was cleaned but not more - no special touches and some things ignored, cups/plate we'd used which were not hotels but our own). If we'd paid less/got a better rate, I'd probably give 5 stars, but we paid around 350 Euro per night so expected something special. I was planning to give a 3 star rating based largely on the room and lack of WOW factor, but on reflection the level of staff service made the stay extra special and for this they deserve 4 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, perfect location at the Scribe”
Reviews.Author: mikesmyth
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Scribe for a few nights in February 2010 on business and really liked this hotel. The location is perfect, right in between Place de l'Opera and Place de la Madeleine and close to the Metro. Went to Buddha Bar near Concorde one night for dinner and it was a nice, quick walk back to the hotel. The lobby has a cool, retro feel to it and the desk staff were all extremely helpful. (It was raining the week I was there and they made sure that I never left with out an umbrella). The concierge brought an outlet converter to my room the first night within 5 minutes of my call to see if they had one I could use. The room wasn't very big, but it had a really nice flat screen TV and the bed was beyond comfortable. Not much of a view, but I was never there, so it didn't matter. The bathroom is a good size and has nice Hermes toilettries and bathrobes. The room where they serve breakfast is really upscale and probably has a 2:1 staff to guest ratio so they're always checking in to see if you need anything. The breakfast was expensive though, I think around 35 or 40 EUR for the buffet, so I usually just had coffee (which was amazing) and a croissant. I would definitely recommend staying here if it fits your budget, I felt like I was right in the middle of everything.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and rooms”
Reviews.Author: Singhjee
Reviews.Content: Very well located, on the main road, good area. Good also for the bus to CDG airport. The rooms and the room service were also good, although I did not check out the restaurants. Expensive breakfast, room service was a better option. Took a little time to get a taxi when I checked out.

Reviews.Title: “Concierge Desk Wizard Booking on EuroStar”
Reviews.Author: David1988
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice palace to be in residence while in Paris. It is only a few block's away from Hermes. The Concerge Desk booked a seat for me on EuroStar into London St Pancras and managed to fetch me a low rate and it was 1st Class. I still talk about it. This was a small miracle especially due to the fact it was on short notice. Merci Concierge!

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant, but not outstanding.”
Reviews.Author: rogbaggs
Reviews.Content: We were pretty happy with this hotel, it was clean, the staff were great and it was superbly located. Compared to many hotels around the world, the room was not of great size, and our view was an internal courtyard and the glass roof of the breakfast room. Very quiet and relaxing and a great centre from which to explore Paris's sights and shops.

Reviews.Title: “the bed was excellent!!!”
Reviews.Author: Mary-Isa
Reviews.Content: hello! we stayed for 2 nights at the scribe. we booked an executive room, but i don't think the extra meters (mostly corridors...) pay for the difference in the rate. besides this, the staff is very kind, and we were very confortable. the shower has blindex box - and i enjoy it, because i hate those plastic curtains that stick to your back during the shower!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not a 5-Star Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Clairedy
Reviews.Content: Our intention was to celebrate our 25th Wedding Anniversary in a 5-star way so a fairly significant amount of time was spent on-line, researching superior hotels in Paris, New York, London and Venice. The 5-star Hotels in New York, London and Venice were excellent, however Le Scribe was a complete disappointment. Be clear on this - in no way is this a 5-star property! It felt more TravelLodge (an Australian 3-star property) to me. The Reception area is quite ugly and basic, the rooms plain and the curtain fabrics poor quality; bed headboard made of cheap material; the whole room and bathroom were just, ordinary! I was completely shocked. I told them of my shock and was upgraded to a slightly improved room in terms of size, however the furnishings were identical. When i was explaining my disappointment to the Front Desk, I queried them on the 5-Star status. I raised the fact that all the 5-star properties I had experienced, had the extra things like bottle of water, turn down service, etc. No that I particularly wanted those extra bits, but that is what distinguished them. Given the lack of furnishings, as well as the lack of those extra items, I genuinely was curious as to how they could compare themselves to the other 5-star properties such as The Ritz etc. They admitted that they weren't in fact 5 Star and said "but we're trying to get that status". So!! They have not altered their rating in any of the hotel sites which is a misrepresentation. At the end of the day, it wasn't an unpleasant experience, however it was a massive disappointment in terms of what I thought was going to be our Paris experience. I certainly wouldn't ever want to stay there again. It just doesn't have anything special about it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: jaseww
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel with massive rooms in a great part of Paris...do it!

Reviews.Title: “ordinary, not memorable”
Reviews.Author: awdub
Reviews.Content: I really don't understand some of the rave reviews on this property - it's perfectly fine, but there's nothing special about it for the price. Our room was well-designed, clean, recently redone, contemporary, high-ceilinged, but a 12x12 cube facing an interior "courtyard" - i.e., other windows. It only could fit a queen bed, and if the suitcase was opened on the luggage stand, there was no way to maneuver around it. From the fire exit diagram, it appears that about half of the rooms are similarly sized, also face other rooms, and have no views at all. We asked for a street-facing room, but were told none were available (although the lobby was quiet, we only saw one other guest on our floor during our entire stay, and almost all of the rooms appeared dark from the street each night). The bed was gloriously comfortable, and the linens were great. The bathroom was a nice size, but the closet consisted of two small built in cupboards, one half-length and one 3/4 length. The check-in was fine, and the concierge was very good. The on-site amenities were fine, but nothing special. The location was also fine, but there are a ton of other luxury hotels within a few block's radius. Bottom line, this is definitely a four-star, and I think it's certified as a four-plus, but that seems like a stretch, and I'd be shocked if it ever got the new five-star rating. Some of the US third-party websites characterize it as a five-star, and that's just plain wrong. For the rate we paid, there were plenty of other hotels that we could have chosen, and we'll go to one of those other hotels next time.

Reviews.Title: “One of the bests options in Paris out of many others”
Reviews.Author: worldtraveller555
Reviews.Content: This is the best hotel I have stayed in Paris from my last previous 5 stays. I booked the executive room which really has a very good size comared to the other hotels in Paris. The room and bathroom have a decent size. The reception and concierge staff were great. I did not mind their breakfast but the most important thing was location. Very well located hotel. Across from the Opera and from the Intercontinental Hotel is not as big as the Inter so for me that is a +. I liked, enjoyed and highly recommend this property, I travel a lot and stay in many hotels and this one delivers from my point of view!!!!. Good Luck. to travel to Paris for Business regularly. This time I found this hotel while I researched some many sites.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and not delivering”
Reviews.Author: starflyergold
Reviews.Content: Just back from Sofitel Sribe in Paris and I was a bit underwhelmed. Room rate was € 207/night (no breakfast) and although I was upgraded to an "executive" room the only way to describe the room was bijou. Bathroom was big though. The hotel in itself was ok though not exactly grande. The elevator area in the lobby could do with a paint job and the service was decidedly bad. Twice housekeeping entered the room without knocking. Room service and minibar prices were shocking, € 8 for a can of beer. These days you won't score points with customers leaving feeling ripped off. Internet was available both cabled and wifi and if you are staying there for more than one night you should note that wifi is much cheaper than cabled, though nothing alerts you to the fact. Ordered food one night and it took over 45 minutes to arrive and one phone call, in fairness they did not charge me for the food. Sofitel these days send out on online questionnaire after the stay and I answered it (same happened to me last month in Buenos Aires). I promptly received a message from the director of the hotel and the head of guest relations offering apologies and an upgrade with champagne welcome should I stay there again. Good offer though not sure it will sway me in favour of staying at Hotel Scribe again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel if you're taking Roissy CDG Bus”
Reviews.Author: bdmnmch
Reviews.Content: One of our main reason for choosing this hotel was due to its location for its close proximity to Roissy CDG Boarding/Alighting points and added with favourable comments from fellow trip advisors. It was a great area but don't expect to see 'affordable cafes' along the main roads for breakfast/lunch as compared to Notre Dame area. It is definitely close to Opera Garnier and Galleries Lafayette, further up would be Au Printemps coupled with ZARA, H&M, GAP, Uniqlo stores in surrounding areas. The BED was really superb! It super comfy and we had no problem falling asleep. Room size was small but it's still much bigger compare to Tokyo hotels. What I liked from the room beside the bed: the lighting was perfect, the design of separate toilet from bathroom, the wardrobe and mini bar was concealed in cabinet doors, the sound proof walls really worked unlike some hotels so you've no noise disturbance at all. Minus point from this hotel as other mentioned was the Bathroom / Shower area. Major problem was the Shower Area. It maybe due to wrong design, due to its unfixed glass partition, there was a gap which caused the water spillage to the floor A Lot. Second major was bathtub position was too high for ladies to climb out and it's definitely dangerous when the floor was wet. I highly recommend ladies to have someone to help out when stepping out from the bathtub. Our trick to avoid messy water spillage was turning the shower not too powerful and showering inside the bathtub area; to avoid splashing of water to the wall and in the end cause water ran unto the floor too from bathtub corner. It's troublesome but worth to try instead of having wet and slippery floor. For amenities, it lacked of the essential items; such as toothbrush and toothpaste but loved the Hermes Shampoo & Body Gel, Bathrobes and Slipper provided. The Hermes shampoo and body shower gel. Staff were friendly and fast check in and check out process but didn't really interact much during our stay. Breakfast was on -1 floor and served simple continental/american buffet style breakfast. A bit expensive but worth to have if you're having an early day out as not easy to get breakfast in surrounding areas. Overall, a great hotel and loved the room minus the bathroom... We didn't regret staying here for our memorable Paris trip. PS: As of 26 Oct 2009, location of Roissy CDG Bus at Rue Rivoli has moved, it was on opposite road from the old ones. I couldn't recall the street name, but you could see the bus from the old bus stop.

Reviews.Title: “Rare find - Good size rooms!”
Reviews.Author: DNLs_mum
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights at the Scribe recently. Room : I must say that it is very spacious compared to my previous experiences with other hotels in Paris. Bed was very comfy...one of the best hotel beds I have ever slept in. Toileteries were Hermes! Wonderful! Location: Conveniently located in Opera area. Close to major shopping centres like Galleries and Printemps. Food : I had room service for breakfast and dinner on both days. As a solo traveller on business I just want to get back to my room to rest after a day of meetings and room service works perfect for me. Food was delivered promptly and warm. No complains. But I must say that full breakfast at EUR35 is very expensive. Conclusion : All-in-all a good place to stay at if you can afford it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, Clean rooms, Great service and they arranged Gluten Free food for my daughter.”
Reviews.Author: Ren74
Reviews.Content: A Trip to remember. Perfect location. Our room was ready at 9am when we arrived. Great service. We had twin beds and a roll away so it was a little cramped but the room was clean and well appointed. The restaurant was very expensive but they understood that my 8 yr old daughter needed her food to be Gluten Free. We had a lot of trouble at other restaurants so she mainly ate room service. I would stay here again definately!

Reviews.Title: “Will stay here again - beautiful hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: Carlashane
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in April for a weekend break. We got an immaculate spacious room overlooking the courtyard, we were a few feet away from the Opera House and within walking distance to the Louvre. The concierge was great with suggesting some lovely restaurants for us, and was very helpful with any other questions. We ordered 2 drinks in the bar and were a bit shocked at the price, but I suppose its the same with most similar hotels. I would deffinitely stay here again and recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “An historic gem with great service!”
Reviews.Author: Jart_7
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at the Scribe and, while not cheap, it was a great high end hotel. Location perfect, spotlessly clean and lovely service - so value for money (if you've got it to spend). Just one warning - they charge €8 for a bottle of water in the bar! A blooming disgrace and a bit of a shame as it leaves a sour taste (no pun intended) to feel ripped off in this way.

Reviews.Title: “Classy Hotel in Fabulous Location”
Reviews.Author: ScottishName
Reviews.Content: Stayed here at the end September and simply loved this hotel. I had the best, most comfortable sleep in their fantastic beds and the room was lovely, luxurious, clean and comfortable. We had a DELUXE Room. If you come from CDG airport - go outside and catch the Roissy bus and it will take you straight in the Opera for 9 Euros and drop you off (1 stop only) at the end of the road to the Scriber - simply could not be better. Taxis are 55 Euros and no faster than the direct bus. Luxurious hotel in the best part of Paris, walking distance to Lourve, and lovely bars, cafes nearby - one tip: Willi's Wine bar for food and ambience and Sherwood for late night jazz and other music - both minutes from the Scribe. Breakfast very expensive but loads of little places nearby. Sightseeing - Le'Open Tour bus very good for getting your bearings in Paris. This area is expensive and we found another MontMarte which was simply buzzing on a Tuesday night - found one street up the hills, full of bars and cafes - very busy, much less expensie and more bohemian, studenty but great vibe. If you book, you will not be disappointed, brilliant hotel.

Reviews.Title: “nice location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: ilsf06
Reviews.Content: just came back from a 3-day stay in hotel scribe. booked it based on location and reviews on tripadviser. the location is great. 2 min walk from the roissy bus. rooms are small by american standards but bigger that most paris hotels, although for $500 a night...staff was nice, both concierges were great and super helpful. we had an issue with the front desk: while i was checking in i asked if i can give one card to check in but actually pay for the stay with another card later that day and was told that that was ok. turns out that they charged the wrong card for one night and refused to fix it. unpleasant and surprising at the hotel of that level. otherwise a nice place to stay. great hand-made chocolate store next door!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, terrific location”
Reviews.Author: tmjm
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Scribe easily lives up to the previous positive comments. First of all is the location. It's in the beautiful Opera area. When researching hotels for this stay, I really liked this hotel's amenities, but remembered liking the St. Germain area and thought we would prefer that area for this stay. I'm so glad we chose this hotel. The St. Germain area now seems so touristy (and on this particular weekend a huge techno music parade was happening creating mobs in the streets). The Opera area a lovely and seems to be filled with more locals. Another plus for this location is the transportation from the hotel. The Roissy Bus runs directly from CDG to Opera (Rue Scribe) - literally one block away from the hotel. It's a one hour nonstop bus from CDG to Paris. Cost is about 9 Euro per person/one way. This is a great plus for this hotel. The hotel is also very near to both the Opera and Madeliene metro stops. Galleries Lafayette is only about 2 blocks away. The Louvre is about a 15 minute walk. The Seine about 20 minutes walk. The staff was lovely. We arrived early and our room wasn't ready. The woman checking us into the hotel took us to the Spa so that we could freshen and change into comfortable clothes. The rooms are a nice size, considering this is Europe. The beds are amazingly comfortable. The TV has English channels like CNN and BBC. The bathrooms are very modern. (Instead of a shower curtain, it does have that little glass shield that unfortunately allows water to spray all over the bathroom). We didn't dine in any of the hotel restaurants. We were just eager to get out into the Paris streets and try some other restaurants. There are many, many restaurants around the hotel. There is the small spa available. Separate jacuzzi and steam rooms for men and women. A small gym with weights and treadmills. Another small amenity...the hotel has umbrellas available for guests in case of rain. It looks like internet service is available for a fee.

Reviews.Title: “Very luxurious!”
Reviews.Author: RjMTkM
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Scribe for 4 nights and had a great time. The room was beautiful with a large bathroom, a GREAT bed with awesome linens and a little balcony with a wonderful street view. We were celebrating our Anniversary, so the day of----they laid out champagne and treats---very nice. The breakfast buffet was included each day and we really enjoyed it. Great croissant, bread, fruit, meats--etc. I am sure you could eat cheaper on the street or in a cafe---but it was good to negotiate its inclusion in our rate/trip. We found that having breakfast included at the hotel gets us up and out quicker and we see more throughout the day. When we were too pooped to go out, we got baguettes with various fillings from nearby bakeries that were AMAZING! Way better than any room service! Within walking distance was a great restaurant-----Chez Clement Opera. VERY affordable, great portions and wonderful food. As many (or more) locals as tourists. The service was typical for Paris---somewhat rushed----but they were responsive to any request and tolerant of our English. We ended up eating there 3 nights---which sounds like alot---but the food was AWESOME! I imagine this is what everyone thinks of as French country or "peasant" food--great roasted chicken, awesome vegetables---etc. We tried beef, seafood and chicken---all great. The sides were very homey and comforting (the best mashed potatoes I've EVER had)----and the sauces were amazing. We tried a few different desserts and they were also great. I am sure we missed out on other great dining experiences, but this place was so close, good and reasonably priced----we just couldn't wait to go back. Overall, the service at the hotel was great---from the staff at the front desk-----to the maid service-----to the wait-staff in the restaurant. The location was also very good----with quick access to public transport and taxis ALWAYS nearby. We haven't had much luck in getting a "5 star" experience in European hotels, but both my husband and I felt this was one of the nicer hotels we'd ever stayed in----American, European or otherwise. We would absolutely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, wonderful experience, highly recommended.”
Reviews.Author: KandRArlingtonCville
Reviews.Content: Overall, we highly recommend staying at the Hotel Scribe in Paris. We just returned from a trip, which was our first in France, and had a fantastic experience at the Hotel Scribe. The location is prime - one block from the Opera Metro station - and within easy walking distance to all of the places you'll want to visit while in Paris, including the Arc de Triomphe, the Louvre, Les Halles, Monmartre, Notre Dame, etc. Room Our deluxe room was very spacious, especially considering our expectations, which were in line with a premium hotel you'd get in San Francisco and/or NYC. Plenty of room for a king sized bed, dresser, etc. Mattress was up to Sofitel's high standards. Our room faced an inner courtyard that had a fountain. Location On the same block as restaurants, shopping, and sightseeing and one block away from the Metro. Note, for anyone traveling to Paris for the first time, the Metro is very convenient and economical - buy the 10 trip ticket and it'll cost you around 12 euro. Taxi to Orly was 30 euro, not sure what it is to CDG, as we used a shuttle service. Service Extremely friendly and helpful. Allowed us to check into our room upon arrival at 11am. Restaurant Didn't use. Note - the room service is ungodly expensive. Save yourself money and grab breakfast down the street at a cafe. Spa Didn't use. Also considered Sofitel Arc de Triomphe - glad we didn't stay in that area of town...a little too busy for us. The Scribe is in a much quieter neighborhood, but if you want to be around the nightlife, the area surrounding the Champs-Elysees. OVERALL We highly recommend the Hotel Scribe and will try to stay there on future trips to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: maggie1030
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a week's stay in Paris and would highly recommend the Hotel Scribe. It is central to transportation (train/subway stations), wonderful and easy to afford sandwich shops just a couple of blocks away, and the great Opera Garnier is just a half block away. The bathroom in our room was quite spacious and we specially liked the strong water pressure!!. We enjoyed the daily buffet breakfast (greats juices, meats, salmon, breads and of course croissants). My compliments to Linda, the Concierge, who helped us in selecting a night illuminations tour of Paris. She was so nice and friendly and helped us greatly in finding the right tour for us. On our last night, we ordered room service (just hungry for pizza and salad) and found that it was not very expensive and was, in fact, quite delicious!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent base in Paris with a touch of luxury”
Reviews.Author: Bunzgirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights, celebrating my husband's birthday. The hotel is ideally situated for exploring Paris, and close to Opera metro station, which is one block away. Madeleine is also less than 10 min walk. We were able to wander down to the Seine, the Louvre etc in 15-20 min and in fact barely used the Metro. The rooms have been fairly recently redecorated and we had perhaps the best night's sleep we've ever had in a hotel room! Very quiet, with a wonderfully comfortable bed. Our room was suprisingly large for a Parisian hotel. My only (very minor) grumble was that the bath was quite high, but the bathroom was well equipped and spotlessly clean. The jacuzzi in the spa was very welcome after a long day of sightseeing. We didn't eat in the hotel - breakfast at 34 Euros (>£GBP30) was simply crazy. Instead there are plenty of cafes, bars and restaurants within walking distance. We bought croissants one morning from one of the ubiquitous branches of the baker Paul and took them down by the river. All in all, I'd thoroughly recommend Hotel Scribe for short break in Paris if you want a base that's central and extremely comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury in Paris”
Reviews.Author: DrHermis
Reviews.Content: My Husband surprised me with our wonderful reservation at Hotel Scribe in the Opera district...pure luxury! Great location, steps away from all! Fab food & Service! It was a pleasure to visit this wonderful Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Wow”
Reviews.Author: jayrush
Reviews.Content: This is an absolutely great hotel I thought. Pricy but not too bad. We had two adjacent rooms. Equi-distant from Madaline subway station and Opera subway station making getting to anywhere very easy. The hotel itself is first class (I think). Everything was just perfect.

Reviews.Title: “elegant and convenient”
Reviews.Author: Lulurose3
Reviews.Content: The hotel Scribe is in a great location for a lot of the tourist parts of Paris. You can walk to the well known stores and it is not too far to the Louvre if you are happy to cover a mile or so. It is also well served by ther RER and the Metro. We got a good deal on the rooms for ourselves and our teenage daughters, so the accommodation did not seem too expensive. Our rooms had been recently refurbished and were well appointed. Eating in the hotel however does feel very pricey and we went out for breakfast. The door staff were superb which is important given the street is very busy and you need to get your luggage loaded and unloaded. The beds are fantastic and the whole hotel feels clean and fresh. This being Paris the service culture can be lacking and it was not possible to get our room cleaned in the morning so my husband could work in the room in the afternoon. As usual it was implied that this was somehow our fault that this wasn't done despite requesting it at 9.00am in the morning! Over all this is a great location and there are plenty of places to eat near by which aren't cheap but won't feel as pricey as the hotel. I would certainly use it again.

Reviews.Title: “I would pay $500 per night to sleep in the most comfortable bed and most quiet room in Paris.”
Reviews.Author: shoppharmacycounter
Reviews.Content: I traveled a lot and stayed at 5 star hotels around the world. Sure staying in down town 5 star Hyatt in San Francisco is better, but considering that it is Paris – Hotel Scribe is everything you need. Amazing location – right in the middle of major metro hub near Opera. We stayed at this hotel July 4-7 2009 and loved every minute of it. You get the best hotel room for the price. Clean and spacious room, lost of mirrors, nice bathroom, good looking new furniture and flat screen TV. Windows are sound proof. Bed is branded by hotel and very relaxing (I know what I am talking about). Waking up calm and ready for another day after busy museums is just what you need. I would pay $500 per night to sleep in the most comfortable bed and most quiet room in Paris. Disappointment was mini bar and breakfast in the hotel. Eggs breakfast from room service will cost you 30 Euros per person and one little can of Heineken from mini bar will cost you 7 Euros. Do not get in to unmarked taxies – 10 Euros trip will cost you 60 and always ask for the menu in the restaurants and if they don’t give it to you – walk away, b/c breakfast will cost you 50 Euros per person, especially near Opera. These f**ers give French bad name!!! 100% recommend Hotel Scribe!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel In Great Location”
Reviews.Author: StevenHampstead
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights to visit Roland Garros for my birthday. We were in a 'Luxury' Room - Room 544. The 'Luxury Rooms' have views of the avenues. The standard rooms look into the courtyard and are quite smaller - we saw one from the corridor. There was a very comfortable king size bed. Flat screen TV with several UK channels. Free tea and coffee facilities. The room was immaculate and large for Paris. The bathroom was large with a separate shower cubicle and a separate toilet closet. There were Hermes toiletries. The lobby and lounges are lovely with crystal chandeliers. However, it is calm and relaxing and not overbearing like some of the Paris 'palaces'. The staff were courteous and helpful. There is a lovely relaxing tea room as part of the hotel where we had lovely tea and patisseries - the best we had in Paris. It also has crystal chandeliers and is on 2 levels - a spiral staircase takes you to window seats overlooking the avenue. Paris was boiling hot and very crowded. The hotel was a lovely calm and relaxing oasis from it all. We retreated to the hotel at about 3.00pm each day we weren't at Roland Garros and it was lovely to sit in the calming lounge after the frenzy of the city. There were a couple of issues that we would like to see changed: i) The tea room was closed on both the Sunday and Monday. This was ludicrous for a 5 star hotel in a capital city and it meant we couldn't enjoy it for 2 days. The lounge served a more restricted choice of patisseries. ii) Towels. We had one bath towel each per day. They did bring new ones at night, but I would rather they had spares in the bathroom as it meant if we bathed at night we had to use the same ones again in the morning. iii) Wardrobe space is very limited.Tiny in comparison to the size of the room. iv) Breakfast. At 34 Euros each it was extremely limited and the same very day. The hot food was inedible for us: limited, greasy and very poor quality and the same every day. The scrambled eggs were runny like soup and the bacon and sausages greasy and under cooked. Very limited choice of coldmeats and cheese - the same every day. After several days we were sick of it and could only manage some toast! At 34 Euros each!Last year we also stayed here and they had crispy Dim Sum as part of the Japanese breakfast buffet. But they were gone this year. There was only a bowl of soup and rice. Breakfast simply isn't worth it here. Also the tea water was never boiled so the tea was undrinkable. The coffee though was lovely. v) Room Service. Our room service meal was very poor. One anaemic omelette that appeared to have been made of powdered egg. Once stone cold club sandwich and cold french fries. For over 60 Euros it was very very poor. Throughout our trip we found the food to be of a very poor standard across Paris. The same menu in every restaurant and poor quality and undercooked. It was pretty dreadful compared to London or New York. It was as if everyone survives on baguettes and croissants! The quality of meats and cheeses is dire! It is also extremely expensive and nothing we ate was worth it. The tourists have to put up with it and it is as if Paris restaurants don't care and are in a timewarp. I would stay here again if they resolve the above issues as it is a lovely hotel in a great location. Otherwise next year we will try the Intercontinental Grand which is virtually next door and looked lovely. But I have no expectations for food even there as every menu is the same - I really do think that Paris has been taken over on the restaurant front by other cities where numerous great Chinese, Indian and Pizza places abound. Paris is just full of old brasseries serving the same menu since the days of yore!

Reviews.Title: “Best service in Paris”
Reviews.Author: cendut
Reviews.Content: After a previous family member's experience staying at the hotel scribe, we were highly recommended due to its LOCATION. The location is really very central, close to everything you'll need in Paris. Galleries Lafayette (only 5 minutes), metro stations, the Madeline, st Honore, Place Vendome, etc. After we stayed there, one thing that really stood out were the impeccable SERVICE. Right the moment we arrived at the check-in desk, we were greeted with and taken care by Eliana in the politest manner one could expect from a Parisien! We were given our rooms, we charged a little extra for street view, and the room was ready 45 minutes later. It was 9 am! I expected to wait until 12-1 pm for our room. The room was small, but compared to other 15 sq Metres 4 star rooms in Paris this was considered Big. The view was excellent, of the grand hotel intercontinental and the street beside it. Room service was excellent. Although a little 'limited' menu but delicious! Cafe Lumiere was also marvelous, the food rivals those michellin star restaurants and fancy swanky establishments I've been (Go for the steak) and excellent value! The menu cost between 20-30 euros! Rosalind the maitre d' was also an angel of a person. Throughout our stay, we were really pampered by the excellent and dependable staff. The concierge never stopped caring for us, arranging tours, explaining how the metro works, maps and shopping tips. Rita really stood out in that department. After our 8 night stay in the hotel we then went to madrid, barcelona and milan (we were on a honeymoon) but no other hotel staff were as caring and dependable and really went out of their way for us. (even principe di savoia) Go for the hotel scribe for its location, its staff, and its price.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, very good location”
Reviews.Author: Daos
Reviews.Content: Sofitel Le Scribe is an very good hotel in a great location. We spent ages researching good hotels and locations to stay in Paris, and finally decided on Sofitel Le Scribe. We have stayed at Sofitel St James in London previously in what can only be described as a TINY room, so I was unsure what to expect in Paris. BUT, we had a great room, it was very large (by Paris standards), very clean and while the view was not great, this did not matter. Check in was fast, and what a great surprise to find 1/2 bottle of Moet et Chandon in our room on arrival! Location wise, it is right beside the Opera, a few minutes walk to Place Vendome, The Louvre and Rue St Honore etc... Overall, very happy with the hotel - and they recommended and some really great restaurants even though we were armed with Paris Zagat Guide. Having researched prices on multiple travel websites, we booked the hotel directly on the Sofitel website, which may have resulted in better room, and champagne.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: CycleChic
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in December of 2008. The hotel is in a wonderful location, close to the Opera and shopping. Walkable from every where in the city, the metro stop is only a few blocks away, but we hardly used it. We had a large room, huge by European standards, large even by American standards. Strange window from the shower into the room, it opened a few times and got water everywhere. Reception was very friendly. Only complaints were we booked a non-smoking room and did not get one and the hotel breakfast was way overpriced. Better off at a boulangerie for breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with charming rooms & good location, But staff could be friendlier”
Reviews.Author: Cabbagetown
Reviews.Content: Hotel Scribe is well-located close to the opera, metro subway stops, excellent shopping, fine bistros, etc. The room was very, very comfortable. The mattress was luxurious, comfortable, and bed linens were of high quality. Our room looked out on to the street and was fitted with two glass doors, the second one had basically sealed out all street noise from the room. The room was furnished elegant furniture and was tastefully decorated. The hallway walls were lined with black and white historic photos on large, seemingly cloth pieces of wall paper. Very nice. The washroom was elegant and highly functional. Our room had an enclosed glass shower and a large soaker tub. The vanity was very elegant. Nice touch with Hermes bath products in the washroom. Public areas of the hotel were luxurious: very nice lobby where the concierge desk is located and nice sitting area adjacent to the check-in desk. The little cafe / library near the entrance with the spiral staircase is charming. One area of the hotel that we feel could be improved is staff service. In general, compared with other 5-star properties we've stayed at, staff at Hotel Scribe could be more friendly. On many occasions, we walked by staff and received no greeting, no "hello", not even a "good morning". For 300+ Euro per night, I suppose we expect more of a welcoming attitude from staff. We had the feeling that we have to appreciate staying at the hotel, rather than staff appreciating our patronage as paying guests. The small gym had three cardio machines and a few weights. If you're looking for cardio exercise, the gym will suffice. If you want to do weight training, the gym will limit you. What we didn't like is the heat that was generated in the small gym room. We realized afterward that ceiling mounted pot lights were directly above the cardio machines. I sweated more than I normally due and would attribute this to the excess heat generated by the pot lights above the cardio machines. What we did like was the spa across from the gym, which was generally excellent. The spa is also equipped with separate men's and women's steam rooms, which we appreciated. Regarding breakfast, 33+ Euro for the breakfast was very, very pricey. We did breakfast for two mornings and then had breakfast outside the hotel. The quality was fine, but the cost was exhorbitant. We've seen better hotel breakfast buffets in Paris during previous trips to the city for closer to 20 Euro. So we recommend that you avoid eating at the hotel. It is Paris, of course, and the city has an abundance of fine eateries where you can get better for less.

Reviews.Title: “Worse 5 * service”
Reviews.Author: HuarenToronto
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this Sofitel-managed hotel for 7 nights in an executive room (small for world; average for Paris). Pros: - in Opera area and near to most tourist sites - everything is in walking distance or short metro ride - the bed is comfortable. - the double glazed windows cut out all city noises - which is very good. Cons: Worse hotel experience and service ever! - staff never greet guests anywhere in the hotel. Mostly, guests are ignored while staff "do their thing". - Compared to other luxury properties, this one is very average for service and valuing guests. - frontdesk (junior staff most of the time with what appears to be limited experience of a luxury hotel experience, surly, cool, inexperience, argumentative, not helpful); - concierge (unresponsive, not helpful, visually annoyed to have to attend to your questions); - doormen (inconsistent greetings - sometimes ignoring you, sometimes smoking and blowing smoke into returning guests, mostly chatty with eachother and other service providers with little attention to guests); - cafe (over-priced for bad and slow service); - restaurant in basement (not good buffet breakfast selection or choices - go across the street to the Intercontinental) - housekeeping (inconsistent - some nights you get turn down and not other nights, morning room make up is slow - on 2 occasions, room not made up when we returned at 3 pm) Overall, value for money - go somewhere else. If you really want to stay in a luxury hotel, add a little more $$ or Euros and stay somewhere else. Anywhere but this property. While Sofitel properties in North America and Asia generally offer more comforts and service, this property does not. It has actually turned us off completely from Sofitel properties. We have written off Sofitel as an option for hotels when we travel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: LPMCC
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel in very pleasant, safe area. Hotel staff all very professional yet friendly and knowledgeable. Beautiful lobby area. Rooms spotless and fine for size despite what other reviewers have said. Extremely comfortable beds. Only downside was that breakfast was 32 euros per head so we had croissants and freshly squeezed orange juice for the four of us for 20 euros in a local cafe! (Come out of hotel, turn right and right again, go down past Gap and beside Zara Home you will see a cafe. Directly behind that is another smaller cafe where we ate) Took the Roissybus from CDG and it left us on Rue Scribe-very handy. Very close to RER Auber (direct line to Disneyland) and Metro Havre-Caumartin. Found small restaurant called Georges Opera to eat in in evenings(turn right out of hotel and down street opposite - past American Diner). Highly recommend Hotel Scribe.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: arisv
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from a weekend escape to Paris where we stayed at Hotel Scribe in a standard room overlooking the corner of rue Scribe and Bvd des Capucines. The view from the room was fantastic as we could see the sun rise above the roofs of Paris in the morning. Hotel Scribe is a very nice hotel with all the bits and pieces that make a 5* (well, 4* Lux according to the hotel's official French listing) just in place. The rooms are exceptionally clean although small (but that's the rule everywhere in Paris). The breakfast buffet menu is quite rich, the bedding is extra comfortable and the bathroom was spacious and brand new, filled with Hermes amenities. We didn't need any particural service from the staff but they were very attentive and helpful at check-in and check-out. I shall try to compare the Hotel Scribe against its competitor Hotel Le Grand (which is just across the street from Hotel Scribe) where we had stayed for three nights back in February '08. The only thing missing from Hotel Scribe is the "glorioso" style in the atmosphere of the hotel which is evident everywhere (hall ways, rooms bathrooms, furniture) in Le Grand, the large lounges and entrance hall and of course ... the "Cafe de la Paix"!! Cafe de la Paix is a Paris institution in terms of cafes and restaurants located on the ground floor of Le Grand and that's where breakfast for the hotel guests is served in the morning. It is also an "haute cuisine" restaurant for lunch and dinner. Such details put Le Grand one click ahead of Hotel Scribe which make Le Grand a true 5* hotel (but, of course, this comes at a price...) considering that at Hotel Scribe we paid 330 Euros per night (including breakfast) for a double room which was really an excellent value for a 5* hotel located in such a convenient and beautiful area of Paris (Opera). We would definitly stay at the Hotel Scribe again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fab location for Paris- a very nice "arrondissement" of Paris”
Reviews.Author: DivingFrenchie
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for a couple of nights in late June and got the range just above the "standard" room so had expectations! I found the room to be pretty small for this type with however a big spacious bathroom. All the other reviews are right: how do you shower standing?? there is no curtain or even a glass panel and all the water goes all over the bathroom floor, making it very slippery ( and potentially hazardous- and I'm NOT an elderly!). So although you have a great pressure, you minimize the shower time as it floods the floor. A shame. The complimentary toiletries may be from Hermes but are tiny and there are very few of them so I was most pleased to have brought my own shower gel & shampoo. The beds are very comfortable with luxurious egyptian sheets ( but then again it's a 5*) and the decor is good and the room very clean. The price of the breakfast is totally outrageous, even by 5* standards ( and I've been in a few without sounding smug) and although we went for it ( it was my b'day) we just found it to be good- not fantastic. The spa- I had a massage and found the therapist to be very good but again, as a regular user of spas, I found the place lacking a bit the indulgence feel you get in other spas. The room can overlook a nice courtyard and making them very quiet ( a bonus in Paris). I found the staff to be courteous but not overly so. Could be so much better working in such an establishment. But maybe they were having a bad day? The big Plus point of this hotel is definitely the location- in a really nice arrondissement of Paris ( Opera) with great shopping around, the place de la Concorde only 15mns walk away and the place Vendome only 10mns walk away- with plenty of fab restaurants and cafés in the area.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Stay at the Scribe”
Reviews.Author: davidbruce
Reviews.Content: We spent 10 days at the Hotel Scribe for a recent vacation in Paris and overall we had a wonderful experience there. This is certainly a high-quality hotel that is worth a splurge if you can afford it. Our room was not big, but it was adequate. The bed was very comfortable, with a small desk area and a flat-screen TV. Best of all, the room was quiet at night. If you have noise concerns, make sure to request a room overlooking one of the inner courtyards. The bathroom was large and nicely appointed, with a big powerful shower, high-quality towels and fabulous Hermes products. A few minor peeves: as others have pointed out, the poor design of the shower door meant it was inevitable that water from the shower would spill out onto the floor. And although they gave us a nice new shower floor mat, on several days they took it away and did not replace it, so we had to call down to ask for one, which was annoying. But these are minor quibbles. My partner got a massage at the spa one time and said it was great. We also used the gym a few times. It is quite small and there's not much to it other than a few cardio machines and one of those 10-in-1 Nautilus-type machines. But you can still manage to get in an OK workout. There's also a nice big whirlpool and steam room that you can use. We didn't have the buffet breakfast down in the basement restaurant every day, because it IS expensive (as is everything in Paris these days), but we thought it was nice enough. We didn't experience any of the problems that others reported here, such as the problems with restocking. It seemed to be well-run, and there was always plenty of food. We often found ourselves hanging out in the nice bar area off the lobby, where they also serve food. With its big glass atrium, it was a relaxing place to sit for a drink or to have a late-afternoon bite at an odd hour. We also had dinner there one night and it was delicious, and you can pick up a light continental breakfast that's a bit cheaper than the full buffet down in the basement restaurant. They often featured live music in the bar, including a pianist and a harpist one evening. The tea salon at the front of the hotel was also a good place for a quick bite. It serves light sandwiches and delicious pastries. We found the staff at the hotel to be fantastic. They were all extremely friendly and helpful to us, and there was no need too big or too small for the concierge staff to help us with. Last but not least, the Hotel Scribe is in a great central location, especially if you like to shop. It is within easy walking distance of the major department stores as well as endless other great shops and boutigues on street after street. It's also within easy walking distance of ooodles of nice restaurants, including many late-night options, and just a block from the large Opera metro stop. And although it's a toursity area, it's not as bad as some other areas of the city. As I said, the hotel is well worth a splurge. It's definitely a luxury hotel, but it's smaller and thus more intimate than some of the larger luxury hotels. The Scribe is a bit pricey, although we were able to get a discounted rate by booking online and paying in advance. The next time we go to Paris, we will likely stay at the Hotel Scribe again.

Reviews.Title: “Total Luxury!”
Reviews.Author: Student123
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night with a friend and got a special expedia rate of £206 per night. On arrivel we were told we'd been upgraded to a luxury room!! Room was totall stunning, high cielings, lovely long window that looked out over the courtyard, comfy beds, and lots of space!!! We used the free spa and weren't disapointed. Yes it is small but it's not busy and the two of us had it to ourselves. We also booked massages, which in retrospect seemed rather overpriced for what we got - 30 mintues for around £55!! I think my friend got the better therapist as mine didnt even offer me a drink of water afterwards! I wouldnt recomend paying this amount of money, but do recomend you check out the spa as it's free to all guests. Location wise it's right in the middle of the Opera and easy to get to anywhere either by walking or taking one of the metro lines. Staff were friendly, attentive and spoke very good English. They even managed to safely return the book I'd left in our room a few hours after we'd checked out! We didnt have breakfast at the hotel as we thought it was rather overpriced at 30 Euros, but there are plenty of places nearby offering a cheaper option. All in all a wonderful luxury one night break, made even better by the upgrade!!

Reviews.Title: “Great bed”
Reviews.Author: Rudders71
Reviews.Content: I stayed here recently for one night on business and finally had the best nights sleep in Paris. The bed was superb and the room a reasonable size, which is difficult to find in Paris. The service was efficient except for breakfast. The breakfast has a good choice however it's not slick and re-stocking takes forever.

Reviews.Title: “Music and Hermes in the bath and in a great location”
Reviews.Author: TheScribelers
Reviews.Content: Perfect situation for exploring Paris. We stayed in a standard double which was very nice. We didn't book breakfasts on account of the 32Eur price tag which we felt was a bit steep even by Paris standards and there are plenty of eateries near by. We did use the complementary spa rooms (one for men and one for women) - they where nice, but very small and we were lucky to have them to ourselves. The rooms are large for central Paris and the beds are very comfortable. We found it clean and quiet and like the fact that you could choose to listen to piped music (or rather what was on the TV) in the bath !! Particularly while using the Hermes soap ! We discovered on departure that 2 bottles of water a day were complementary with only the additional ones in the fridge incurring a charge. Our only real complaints was the shortness of the wardrobe space and the fact that the daily weather forecast left in the room each evening was wrong 2 days out of 4.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Scribe was my dream come true!!”
Reviews.Author: kingfan100
Reviews.Content: I booked my vacation through aa.vacations. and was nervous if this hotel would be okay. I was a little nervous after reading some of the reviews. We arrived at the airport and took the rossybuss directly to the opera area which is a short walk to the hotel. It was a little disorienting when we got off the bus because the buildings are so huge and they look alike, so it took us a few minutes to spot the hotel but once we did everything was excellent. We arrived at 9:30 am and hotel clerk was able to get us in our room right away. The room was awesome! Everything was clean and new. The bathroom was all marble floor and very clean. They still have no shower curtains but there was a half glass door and I would puta towel on the floor to catch any water because the floor is very slippery when wet. There is a seperate room for the toilet which was also very clean and my parents room had a little different floor plan. There room overlooked the street and my room overlooked a small courtyard that looked down over thehotel lobby. Not much to look at but I liked being able to look at the weather so that I knew if I needed my raincoat. The weather was unseasonable cool and rainy. I purchased a metro pass, so we used the metro all the time and went everywhere with no trouble. One day we went on a day tour to Mont St Micheal which i would also highly recommend. Our vacation package included the nonstop air from chicago the hotel and breakfast everyday. The room had a minibar, coffee/tea maker with free coffee and tea but the stuff in the minibar was expensive so we set that stuff aside and put our own drinks inside. The hotel provided two free bottles of water everyday which was nice. The breakfast was excellant. They have a small variety of cereal, pastry's and scrambled eggs, bacon or sausage. A fruit pyramid and a variety of juices. We would be seated at a table and the waiter would take our drink order and then we were free to browse the food tables. We were offered free USA Today paper which was nice. I eat a very healthy diet so I was glad to see dried fruit and high fiber cereal, tea, fruit and different types of breads/muffins, I can see why some reviews may say that the breakfast is expensive at 30 Euros apiece but this was included in my vacation and we looked forward to it every morning. I probably would not have wanted it if I had to pay extra, but it was convient to meet for breakfast everymorning to discuss the days events at 7am and then head out by 8:30 to beat the crowds. If someone expects this breakfast to be like hometown buffet they will be disappointed. It is a small elegant breakfast with white linens and waiters. Kind of fancy and cute! Near the hotel there were a few cafe's and a english movie theartre. The concierge was excellant and always helped or answered all of my many questions. They spoke fairly good English. The only problem that I had at the hotel was the heating system was whisper quiet so I couldn't tell if it was running but the maintance man showed me with his laser beam thermometer that indeed it was working correctly. It just took and hour or so for the temperature to change and then I had to figure out what was comfortable for me. Phone charges and internet charges were a bit confusing, so I decided to buy the 30 minute interenet card for 10 euros at the front desk. They have two computers in the business center one has an english keyboard and the other a french keyboard. This allowed me to sign on to my email to send messages to family back home. With the time change it was best to use email so that I wouldnt wake them up with phonecalls. Our room was very quiet except when I could hear a kid run through the hallway occasionally and at 1am I could hear other guests come back after a night on the town. After 3 nights I didn't notice anything...I had settled in to the hotel and slept very good. I think I would buy a table fan to give me a little noise for the room since I use one at home I think this would have helped me sleep better the first night. The time change probably also caused my sleep problem. Also we went to bed early the first night and I disrupted the maid and she wasn't able to do the turndown service which would have helped because I discovered on the second night that she pulls the drapes closed at night with the light blocking panel which helped because there are spotlights in the courtyard until 1am which may have also helped in my sleeping problem. That was cured on night two when the maid turned down the beds and drew the curtains and put a little chocolate on my pillow. My fondest memories of hotel scribe was being greated my the hostess for breakfast every morning and on the day that we left as I was wheeling my suitcase out the door to catch the rossybus back to t he airport... I turned around and the 3 doormen/bellman were standing in a row in there uniforms. They waved at me and smiled and one of them said something like Goodbye and have a save journey, come back again. in a mixture of French and English. It was perfect....I couldn't have imagined or dreamed this trip any better and staying at Hotel Scribe make all the difference. I would love to go back again and I would definately want to stay here again. This hotel is a diamond in the rough. Everyone in Paris was friendly and would help if they could...some couldn't speak much English but most knew more English than I knew of French. I had read in a travel book that sometimes Americans may appear rude because we live a faster paced life and we expect places to open exactly at such an such time. So I made it my first priority to be patient, understanding, polite, and smiled when I entered the store or place of business. In return everyone was eager to please and some went out of there way to help us find places on my map. I never thought that I would love Paris. My daugher picked this destination for her Senior Gift because she wanted to see the Eiffel Tower. I never thought I'd ever go here but I'm sure glad we did. My daughter and I will always have the memories of this week in Paris and we often say we would like to jump back on the plane and go back to Hotel Scribe.

Reviews.Title: “Best for shopping in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: venefica
Reviews.Content: Scribe hotel is absolutely terrific place to stay for those who come shopping to Paris. You just go out of the hotel, come across the street - and there you are, Grands magasins are at your disposal. Got tired? Loads of small cafes around where you can have a Croque Madame with salad and a glass of wine. In the evening you would easily reach Grand cafe and Cafe de la Paix - 2 well known restaurants in Opera area - and enjoy oysters and finest champagne. All and all, the location is just amazing. Rooms are also of a very high standard. Stylish, wonderfully clean, quiet and comfortable. I specially enjoyed small drawings instead of usual pictures on the walls. A lot like fashion style. White slippers, bathrobes, each and every accessory usual for 5 star level. Service desk at the lobby is efficient and farsighted, the information desk is always ready to help, book a table whenever you want it, and do like anything in the world)). It was a second time I visited this hotel, and they changed the design a little bit. I would say for the better. Nice green sofas in Lobby and corridors. The only thing I didn't like about Scribe is the breakfast - surprisingly poor for a hotel of this type. The breakfast room was really small, and since there were a lot of people on Mai holidays staying in the hotel, there was always a queue of those who wish to eat. The choice of dishes was pretty poor as well - loads of croissants all style, but no omlette, bacon with eggs, or ham, or vegetables...We always had to wait for the waitress to bring coffee or tea (which is by the way palletized only), stuff had no time to change the dishes if something ended. We used a nearby cafe to have breakfast twice, and never regretted! I would go back to the hotel and certainly recommend it. Just probably it is better to avoid the breakfast. At least when in Paris, use each and every moment to try something new!

Reviews.Title: “It's wonderful !”
Reviews.Author: Lucky3000
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Scribe during Christmas/New Years with my family and it was fantastic! The location was perfect, right between the Opera Garnier and La Madeleine, also close to metro stations. If you love to walk (who doesn't in Paris), you can walk almost everywhere from the Scribe. Lots of great cafes and restaurants nearby. The rooms were great- separate shower and tub, plenty of space. The bed was extremely comfortable. We didn't eat at the actual hotel, but we did have afternoon tea at the Maison du The, which is just off the lobby. It was great. If you love to shop, Galeries Lafayette (as well as many other great stores) is less than a minute walk away. We loved the Scribe and I would highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel near Opera”
Reviews.Author: London1666
Reviews.Content: Smart, clean, centrally located hotel opposite the Grand Intercontinental and 2 minutes walk from Opera metro station. The hotel is five minutes walk from Place Vendôme and the big department stores. Our room was small but nicely decorated and had views of the rooftops of Paris. I would recommend a room on a high floor as road noise is probably significant on the lower floors. We did not eat breakfast in the hotel (not included in our package and €35 per person) and thought the bar area was a little lacking in atmosphere. Front desk staff were helpful.

Reviews.Title: “My new favorite paris hotel”
Reviews.Author: ovlov246
Reviews.Content: Stayed there 3 nights in January 2008 and it was magnifique! I am usually in Paris 2 times/yr and this is my new favorite, hands down. Great location, wonderful staff, immaculately clean rooms, quiet and sunny. My room was quite large, especially for central Paris - I have stayed at the Hyatt Madeleine (another great hotel, prior favorite) in the same neighborhood but there it is hard even for one person to turn around - not so at the Scribe! King size bed with plenty of room to spare, nice working desk, huge dresser, high ceiling, charming modern french decor. Bathroom was also enormous, with fluffy robes, custom pristine white towels, the works. The only (minor) complaint: no shower curtain/glass door, which seems to be a french proclivity for wet floors rather than ruin the "look". I had an interior room facing a bland courtyard (but the window landscaping helped) and was able to work (and sleep) in utter silence, a rarity for Paris. Breakfast was quite good but agree with other reviewers that at these prices, a bit more variety could be offered. But breakfast staff efficient and very pleasant. Also must commend the concierge - while I normally avoid restaurant recommendations from concierges because they send you to the tourist traps - this recommendation was spot on. I asked for a good place for cassoulet, where locals go. She sent me to a "natives only" restaurant where I was certainly the only foreigner they'd seen in awhile, but my high school french was sufficient. Food was scrumptious and atmosphere was terrific, lively. Can't wait to go back to the Scribe - its the right mix of modern amenities with classical french flair. Pricey but worth it if your expense account allows!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel once the renovation is complete....”
Reviews.Author: ccrannell
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for two nights to celebrate our Wedding Anniversary in Paris. The room was extremely nice and very updated. The bathroom was big with all of the amenities. The hotel itself is beautiful; modern and charming "paris like" all at the same time which we wanted. The room was a good size, not too small. We felt the bed was super comfortable which is a lot for my husband to say since he travels the world for his job and stays at mainly five and four star hotels. The location of the hotel was perfect. We walked the to all of the sites without any problem. There is a lot of really nice shopping around the hotel and resturants too. We did get a room that did have scaffolding in front of the window, which probably explains the great rate we got on the room per night. This was not a big deal since it was warm in Paris and we had the air conditioning on the entire time. The only downfall we had was at around 8:00 in the morning we could hear a slight banging just on Friday morning , not on the Saturday morning. It was obviously the workers trying to complete the renovation. I will mention this renovation is basically done. Just a few finishing touches going on. Overall, we would stay here again when we return to Paris. One more thing.. the staff in the hotel were all very nice and helpful. Everyone spoke perfect English and we were always greeed with a genuine smile...
